results.description:
NEW!!! 

SPECIAL OFFER FOR MEETUP MEMBERS

Get $200 off the regular registration price of $299.  Use this special link to get your discount and register today! 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/womancon-2015-tickets-15305433965?discount=MEETUP200

Join us for a day of inspiration, solid advice on starting and growing your business, and connecting with awesome women entrepreneurs like you!


Full agenda & speaker list at http://womancon.com 

+++++++
Experience womancon2015 on September 29th!

We’re excited to offer our audience a special discount to one of the best conferences for women entrepreneurs taking place this fall in NYC – womancon2015. 


When:            September 29, 2015

Where:           Digital Sandbox, 55 Broad Street, NYC

Time:              9:00am – 6:30pm

Discount:      Pay just $99 for the entire day!  Save $200 off the regular ticket price of $299.  

Use discount code = MEETUP200

Tickets:   http://www.womancon.com/register/ 

Womancon2015 promises to be the best Womancon to date, with an all-star lineup of speakers including: 

JANET HANSON - founder and former CEO of 85 Broads (now Ellevate Network) – a groundbreaking organization for women in business. She is also the founder of the $2 billion institutional money management company Milestone Capital Management.  Janet has helped many women entrepreneurs to realize their dreams and is a true inspiration!

DORIE CLARK – renowned author of several best selling books about personal branding, professional speaker and branding expert.

EGYPT SHERROD - Host of HGTV’s Property Virgins and “America’s most beloved real estate agent,”.  She’s the author of “Keep Calm….It’s Just Real Estate: Your No-¬‐Stress Guide To Buying A Home” and CEO of the Atlanta based “Egypt Sherrod Real Estate Group.”

EMILY HARNISH - Director of @Work Marketing for T-Mobile, where responsible for leading the marketing strategy and execution for T-Mobile’s growing @Work business segment.

MICHELE MARKEY - Vice President of Kauffman FastTrac, the ultimate resource for entrepreneurs, and author of SheVENTURE: Success Strategies for Female Entrepreneurs.

DENISE CALDWELL - fashion and beauty expert who has styled Hollywood’s elite, including Leighton Meester and Michelle Monaghan, and has been a part of the teams that have worked with such famous faces as ﬁrst lady Michelle Obama, Halle Berry, Beyonce, Kendall and Kylie Jenner, Sarah Jessica Parker, Jennifer Lopez and more!

KATHRYN PETRALIA - Chief Operating Officer and Co-Founder of Kabbage, Inc. She started Kabbage along with her two co-founders in 2009, and it’s grown from 3 employees and a PowerPoint to more than 115 employees and 300,000+ customers in just over 5 years.

JULIE SYGIEL - Founder and Chief Creative Officer of Dear Kate, a startup that makes high performance underwear and active-wear. Julie is also co-founder of The Lady Project, an organization that connects, inspires and showcases awesome women doing amazing things.

SARAH KAUSS - Founder and CEO of S'well bottles, which are beautifully crafted composed of non-leaching and non-toxic 18/8 stainless steel, that keeps your drinks cold for 24 hours and hot for 12, while giving back to those in need. S’well is a charitable community member and proud partner of charitable organizations. 

LYDIA LOIZIDES - Founder, Talentedly – a subscription-based online service designed to help people make professional progress.  Lydia is a technology entrepreneur and organizational innovation expert.. A serial entrepreneur, with an IPO, JV and two acquisitions in consumer internet products and services, Lydia has extensive experience in early-stage companies. 

LORI HOBERMAN - a well-known force in the in the New York City venture community who advises entrepreneurs and investors on how to build successful businesses and strategically guides them through the emerging, later stages and exits of their companies.

DONNA CRAVOTTA - a Social Visibility Expert, the CEO of Social Sage PR™ and the creator of the Total Social PR System™ who empowers entrepreneurs, small businesses, and teams by teaching them to use Social Media, SEO, and PR as tools to listen, ignite conversations, and foster relationships that result in unforeseen business expansion.

CHRIS DESSI - founder of Silverback Social

KELSEY MEYER - cofounder of Influence & Co. a content marketing firm that specializes in knowledge extraction, content creation and distribution. Influence & Co. was named to Forbes’ 2014 Most Promising Companies In America List, and won the 2014 Empact Award for best Advertising company.

LEAH HURLEY - Founder of Craft, Inc.,, where she works with businesses and organizations to amplify their impact through marketing & brand strategy, communication management and media & event production. Clients include The Bay Club, Brooklyn Based, Fiddler's Green Farm, Forefront Church, The Lewis Institute at Babson College, Pop!Tech and The Restorative Justice Institute of Maine.

LESLIE CAMPISI - Public Relations Expert will provide you with tools, tactics, advice on how to establish your expertise and thought leadership to build your brand and your company's brand.

GERI STENGEL - President, Ventureneer & Contributor to Forbes, Huffington Post, Inc. and Women 2.0.

LIZ O’DONNELL - General Manager of Double Forte Public Relations, Founder Hello Ladies and Author of Mogul, Mom & Maid: The Balancing Act of the Modern Woman. 

VIVIAN GIANG - Freelance Writer, Editor & Producer.  Regular contributor to Fortune, Fast Company, Quartz & Marie Claire.  

CHRISTINE LAGORIO-CHAFKIN - Senior Writer, Inc. Christine’s work has appeared in the New York Times, The Washington Post, The San Francisco Chronicle, The Village Voice and The Believer.

Panels and Sessions

Womancon will also host a fireside chat with the Earnst & Young Entrepreneurial Winning Women program and Sarah Kauss, CEO and founder of S’well, who has leveraged the program to outstanding success.

And, of course the day would not be complete without the fan-favorite, fast-paced “Pitch the Media” session where a star-studded panel of media experts provides live, candid feedback to women business owners about what it takes to captivate the media's attention and secure media coverage.  Pitch the Media features Liz O'Donnell, Author & Sr. VP Public Relations, DoubleFortePR, Geri Stengel of Ventureneer/Forbes, Vivian Giang of Fast Company and Christine Lagorio-Chafkin of Inc. 

You won’t want to miss the all-new interactive and instructive panel that was created specifically for the Womancon audience, “Now What?”.  Experts from a variety of disciplines will provide answers and advice to YOUR entrepreneurial questions and challenges. 

Networking

Womancon2015 attendees will have more opportunities to network with a purpose by establishing and deepening relationships with other attendees, the media, panelists and speakers.  

All attendees will receive complimentary gift bags full of beautiful and practical items and enjoy wonderful, healthy food for breakfast, lunch, snacks and a cocktail reception, sponsored by the stylish and accessible clothing brand JoeFresh. 

What you can expect to take away

Attendees at this year’s even should expect to come away more educated and better prepared to tackle any obstacle they may be facing when starting or growing a business.  Specific ideas on next steps, action plans and how to remain inspired and action-oriented will permeate the day.  
Incredible Resources

The day will be packed with resources for every stage of the entrepreneurial journey – T-Mobile, Kaufmann Foundation’s FastTrac program, Goldman Sachs 10,0000 Small Businesses, Earnst & Young Entrepreneurial Winning Women, Nexus staffing, SproutSocial, Breather, UPS, Hello Fresh, Sticker Mule and so much more! 

   
Don’t miss out on womancon2015! This is an investment in your entrepreneurial future that will allow you to connect with the media, successful women business founders, experts in a variety of disciplines, other like-minded women entrepreneurs and top-notch resources – paying dividends for years to come.  

REGISTER NOW WITH YOUR SPECIAL DISCOUNT CODE = MEETUP200

Registration Link: http://www.womancon.com/register/

results.description:
The first Passive House certified project in a NYC Landmark District is completed!

NYPH is happy to share this event hosted at the Building Energy Exchange (BEEX).  This recent retrofit led by Baxt Ingui Architectstransformed a historic Brooklyn Heights brownstone into a Passive House certified gem, aligning the highest architectural preservation and environmental standards in a single project. Please register by clicking here.


Passive House, the high-comfort, low-energy building standard, is enjoying a huge amount of attention in New York City policy circles. Featured in Mayor de Blasio's climate action plan, One City: Built to Last, Passive House is gaining recognition as an effective strategy to massively reduce energy consumption in commercial and residential building sectors.

Key members, Michael Ingui of Baxt Ingui Architects and Kevin Brennan of Passive House Academy, will speak about the challenges encountered and creative solutions developed throughout the design, construction, and certification process. Other project team members will be on hand to discuss how their collaborative design process allowed them to refine a repeatable, systematic approach for applying the Passive House standard to masonry retrofit row house construction.


SPEAKERS


Michael Ingui, Baxt Ingui Architects

Kevin Brennan, Passive House Academy

Sam McAfee, Fentrend

Eoin Killeen, Kleen Construction


AIA CREDIT


This program is available for 1.5 AIA CEUs

REGISTRATION


Please register by clicking here

Volunteer duties will entail prepping, greeting, serving, and cleaning. The soup kitchens are restricted to small groups, so we reserved two shifts of volunteering. 

Morning Shift: 10 people max
Holy Apostles Soup Kitchen
296 Ninth Avenue @ 28th St.

results.description:
Are you passionate about wanting to make and market a favorite recipe?

Whether you have an idea, a recipe or products already in market, this inspiring, content-packed workshop will help you better understand how to successfully engage in the growing $86 billion U.S. specialty food industry!

Learn from industry expert Terry Frishman as she leads you through the key steps to effectively develop, manufacture, package, distribute and market your most sought after recipes. During this intensive 3-hour workshop, she will guide you in the strategic thinking involved to get started, while layering invaluable insights into how industry trends and your personal values can influence your business opportunities.

Topics include:

• Specialty food and natural industry overview

• Top trends and key opportunities

• Importance of a mission

• Powerful product positioning

• Why packaging is critical

• Food scientists and shelf-life testing

• How to navigate production

• Pricing and sales strategies

• Pros and cons to brokers and distributors

• Promotion and sales materials content

• Getting started with public relations...

Who should attend this workshop?

• Aspiring food entrepreneurs

• Small-business / restaurant owners wanting to launch a food product

• Small food manufacturers who want to grow their businesses.

Instructor

Terry Frishman, Culinary Business Consultant, Instructor and Expert, specializes in launching and growing food businesses. With over 20 years of experience, Terry helps move culinary businesses forward with strategic and tactical assistance. She won many awards while working with large companies like Kraft General Foods and Newsweek, and has helped hundreds of aspiring entrepreneurs and small businesses. Terry holds an MBA from Columbia Business School. She regularly instructs and lectures at culinary schools and industry events, and has been a guest speaker on Food Network, at the International Fancy Food Show and the International Restaurant Show. Terry recently was Sarabeth’s International Sales Manager. Her boutique consulting company - Creative Marketing Workshops, LLC - is starting a new division, Culinest.com, with customized teams of innovative thinkers and doers who are committed to excellence.

Workshop Fees

Online registration $59, walk-ins $69
There is a $10 discount on all Student and SEAP registrations
(valid ID must be presented at the door).

Register : http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?oeidk=a07eb598fax9942f408&llr=7bofavbab

results.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Ethan.  I am going to be giving tennis lessons in the early morning on the weekdays starting time at 8:00am and will end at 9:30am, could extend if requested by the attending players.  There will be no charge for the lesson.  The purpose of the lessons is to help players who want to get better in all aspects of the game.  We will work on the forehand, backhand, backhand slice, net play, serve.  If there are any other suggestions the player want to work on, I will gladly try my best to help.  As for my experience, I have played for over 20 years, played all through high school, played Division 3 at Rutgers-Newark University, played in USTA tournaments as well.  My highest rated NTRP rating was a 5.0 back during my peak playing days.  As for equipment, I do have extra racquets and have a 150 ball hopper which is currently filled up, so yes, you will be hitting many balls.  What I don't have is a tennis instructor's license, which I am currently working on to get, it is called the recreational instructor's license from the USPTA.  By giving these lessons, I will also gain more experience in teaching and learn valuable insights on how to instruct the game of tennis.  Last of all, I will accept donations, no more than $10, half will go to Andrew, for the upkeep of this meetup group, the other half for gasoline, I do live in Bergen County, and equipment, mostly replacing the tennis balls that are losing air.  Just to remind everyone, the donation is just a suggestion, no payment is necessary to attend the lessons.  Thank you everyone and hope to see you on the court.

P.S. - Don't be shy and sign up, I am very easy going and friendly when it comes to helping others to enjoy this sport.  My goal is to help anyone willing to learn and improve their game and to help Andrew out.  This will also help me as well, avid tennis fanatics like yourself will shape the kind of instructor I will become.  Thank you to everyone who's interested in advance.

Fellow tennis fan, 

Ethan S.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be at one of the 2 enclosed singles court.
results.name: Tennis Lesson for NTRP rated 3.5 and Below

results.description:
PLEASE ONLY RSVP 'YES' if you can physically attend.


WE NEED AS BIG A TURNOUT AS POSSIBLE!!!


DATE: September 29, 2015

COURT: Bronx Supreme Court –Criminal Term

265 E161st St.

Bronx, NY 10451

JUDGE: BARRETT,S

PART: 60

ROOM: 300

To arrive at the courthouse:  take the B, D and 4 subway lines to 161 St Yankee Stadium. You'll have a short walk to the courthouse.

Please note, we're all wearing blue to show unity and stand out.


On July 25th, Ernesto Bailey, a Bronx man was arrested for torturing a cat to death by setting it on fire.


The police say that at 11 a.m. officers responded to a report about a dead animal in front of 690 East 182nd Street. According to the NYPD, a building superintendent showed the cops a video "of a male pouring fluid on a cat who was lying on the ground in front of the location. The male then proceeded to use a lighter to light the cat on fire before fleeing."


After seeing the suspect in the video, they canvassed the building, police say, and found Ernesto Bailey, 31, in his apartment and arrested him. He has been charged with aggravated cruelty to animals, torture of an animal, reckless endangerment and arson. The police released a photograph of the sidewalk where the arson occurred, as well as a truly distressing photo of the dead cat.


We need phone calls, letters and emails sent to the prosecutor!!

This is to request the MAXIMUM punishment, NO leniency, and NO PLEA DEAL for ERNESTO BAILEY CASE#:[masked]

DA Robert T. Johnson's office:[masked]


The Office of the Bronx County District Attorney


198 East 161st Street

Bronx, NY 10451

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

For this meetup we may have some small chit chat here and there, but our purpose is singular: to get some writing done. We will be meeting in the events room at the Todt Hill-Westerleigh Library on Victory Blvd close to CSI. They are tables and chairs for us, so bring your notebooks, journals or laptops with you to get your work done. There are outlets in the room and the library offers free wi-fi. There is also a parking lot and bus stop right outside the building for your convenience!

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

Welcome to the first ever B2B Tech Marketing Meetup – NYC


The objective of this monthly meetup is to cultivate a valuable and interactive exchange of knowledge and networking for B2B tech marketers.

Each month we will feature a marketing related subject-matter expert to present a 30 minute workshop.

When
Tuesday September 29 from 6.00pm – 8.00pm

Agenda  
6.00pm – 6.45pm  Registration + Networking Activities 
*Food & Drinks will be served

6.45pm – 7.30pm   Lesson Learned Workshop + Q&A  


Where 
Diligent Corporation @ 1385 Broadway (& W 38 Street), 3rd Floor

Attendees  
B2B Tech Marketers in the tri-state area

Speaker 
Jon Russo, Founder of B2B Fusion 
Jon Russo is a former 3 time B2B Chief Marketing Officer in companies ranging from former divisions of General Electric to successful Silicon Valley start ups. Most recently, Jon headed marketing and inside sales for privately held ReturnPath, the email deliverability company for Eloqua, Marketo, ExactTarget/Salesforce.com among others.


Subject
Demand Generation - Lessons Learned


Jon will be leveraging his years of experience implementing and managing demand generation programs at B2B tech organizations both large and small. 

See all you Tech Marketers there!

results.description:
6:00 - 6:30 - register with security, mingle, eat

6:30 - 7:15 - Gwen Shapira - "When Bad Things Happen to Good Kafka Clusters" - Gwen Shapira shares few war stories from a year of helping customers use Kafka in production and shares tips on how to avoid similar problems on your cluster.

7:15 - 8:15 - Jay Kreps - Stream processing  -

Most software systems continuously transform streams of inputs into streams of outputs. Yet the idea of directly modeling stream processing in infrastructure systems is just coming into it's own after a few decades on the periphery.

This talk will cover the basic challenges of reliable, distributed, stateful stream processing. It will cover how Apache Kafka was designed to support capturing and processing distributed data streams by building up the basic primitives needed for a stream processing system.

Finally it will explore how these kind of infrastructure maps to practical problems based on our experience building and scaling Kafka to handle streams that captured hundreds of billions of records per day.


8:15 - Winner of the Strata Conference Ticket is announced, please make sure you register and attend the meetup to win. Your name will be entered when you arrive and selected (if you want to participate) at this time. Good luck!


8:15 ~ 8:30  - Lightening Talks :

- Michael Rosencrantz, Viacom

- Cole Brown, Concord

8:30 ~ 9:00  - Networking

results.description:
Great news -- we're taking the meetup on the road for Strata + Hadoop World New York 2015! Thanks to Collective for graciously agreeing to host.

After the customary libations we'll proceed with a trio of Lightning Talks:

Talk 1:

Using Impala as a Service Backend: What We’ve Learned (15 mins)

Chris Ingrassia, Senior Director Engineering, Collective

Impala clearly has value as a SQL-on-Hadoop tool for performing analysis and running ad-hoc queries over the data you already have in Hadoop, but what happens when you take the plunge and try to hook part of a service into it over JDBC and use it as you might a “traditional” database?  In this presentation, we will review what Collective learned through the implementation of Collective’s internal reporting service, Vega, which makes extensive use of Impala in conjunction with Spark, Parquet, and Spray across a 165 node YARN+Impala cluster and roughly 13 billion rows of data.

Talk 2:

Support for Nested Types in Impala (15 mins)

Marcel Kornacker, Chief Architect for Data Technology, Cloudera & Alex Behm, Software Engineer, Cloudera

Impala 2.3 includes support for complex schemas, aka nested types (containing arrays and maps). This talk will give an overview of the extended SQL syntax and some preliminary performance results, comparing the flat relational TPC-H schema with its corresponding nested schema.

Talk 3:

Impala Resource Management with YARN (15 mins)


Matt Jacobs, Software Engineer, Cloudera

Impala 2.3/CDH 5.5 includes a number of new improvements that better enable Impala to share cluster resources using YARN. This talk will contain a brief overview of resource management options for Impala users today, improvements we've made in the CDH5.5 release, and how to use Impala with YARN successfully.
results.name: Impala Lightning Talks in NYC (Special Strata + Hadoop World 2015 Location)

results.description:
THE TOPIC:

Construction phase can be as complicated as design phase for large scale projects. Cloud based construction coordination is one of the best way to bring all the parties together in one platform. It helps communicating better between the design team and contractors. This presentation will focus how Turner manages 3D coordination process for large scale projects using Autodesk BIM 360 Glue and explaining the challenges to set up, run 3D coordination, managing multiple trades and disciplines.
It will also focus how to use this tool for collaboration between design and construction team, addressing the issues on time and quickly comparing to traditional 3D coordination.

Presentation will also focus on how design teams can be involved and contribute coordination process using Revit and Autodesk BIM 360 Glue, providing some tips which can be used at the CD Revit model development.

THE SPEAKER: AYSE POLAT

Ayse is the Field Operations BIM Manager for NY Main at Turner Construction Company. She currently leads overall BIM operations and 3D Arch/MEP coordination for construction sites in New York City area. Ayse is a licensed architect and before joining Turner in 2010, she had designed and worked on several architectural projects throughout NY and NJ area. Her both design and construction experience provides a bridge between design and construction, helps collaboration of all team players in construction phase.

***********************************

Can't attend in person?  Join the GoToWebinar

Please register for Practical Application of BIM 360 Glue for Large-scale Projects in Construction on Sep 29,[masked]:00 PM EDT at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/2345238880237565954

results.description:
Paramhansa Yoganada, author of the spiritual classic Autobiography of a Yogi, is renowned for bringing yogic teachings to the West. His message was non-sectarian and universal, and stressed the importance of direct spiritual experience, which he called Self-realization, “the knowing – in body, mind and soul – that we are one with the omnipresence of God”. Join us for this rare opportunity to learn the beginning techniques on the path of Kriya Yoga, led by Kyle McDonald, which combines the practice of advanced ancient yogic techniques with spirituality in all aspects of daily life.

These techniques include Yogananda’s Energization Exercises, which help us to gain control over the body’s subtle energy flow (Prana) and Hong Sau ( “I am spirit” in Sanskrit)’ an ancient ego-dissolving, consciousness expanding pranayama practice that stills the mind by calming the breath, allowing us to cultivate the concentration needed for deep meditation and inner communion with the divine. We will also learn techniques to help awaken the energy in our chakras, particularly the Agya chakra (spiritual eye) and Anahata (heart center) chakras; awaken our intuition and recognize Divine guidance. Kyle will also share tips on how to create sacred space at home and commit to a daily meditation routine.

Click Here to sign up.

If you mention you're with Ananda you can attend on a drop-in basis for $22 per class.

A WEEKLY COURSE
(4 sessions) Tuesday, September 29–October 20, 6–7:30pm
Members: $110 / Nonmembers: $120

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and too many people to talk to. 

Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!


This way of meeting people is 200 times better than Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn, both in terms of reaching entrepreneurs and investors, doing so on practically on a ZERO dollar budget. Bring plenty of business cards.


The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Remember this is a FREE event, there is a one drink suggested minimum, because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event. 


Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group


Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz

results.description:
This meetup group was started by the founder of the DaniWeb.com IT Discussion Community who was getting frustrated that all of the meetups she was interested in attending were based in NYC, and it was nearly impossible to get to them on weeknights for people who work out on Long Island.

Join a group of people who work in the tech industry throughout Long Island.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.
results.name: DaniWeb Techie Meetup - Last Tues of the Month

results.description:
Join us as we come together for a night of startup/tech networking and story sharing. If you don't have a specific agenda, hang out and mingle with like-minded folks and enjoy the great atmosphere. Who knows who you'll meet or what you'll learn! You must be 21+ to attend.

Drink specials:

$5 drafts

$6 well drinks

$6 wines

Looking to build your network at the mixer? Name & Number is THE fastest way to connect with new people. Enter a name and number in order to automatically save the contact to your phone and prepare a text to send that person so they have your name and number too.

Name & Number is also available on Apple Watch. Speak their name and number into your Apple Watch to quickly save their info to your contacts list. #LifeHack

Available on App Store & Google Play:

https://itunes.apple.com/am/app/name-number/id987295718

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.sideprojects.nameandnumber

Thank you to our sponsor!

For nearly 20 years, Premier has been the Bay Area's go-to staffing resource for the emerging growth and tech industries. Today, Premier brings their expertise to New York City, where they continue to place rockstar candidates in the functional areas of Administration, Operations, HR and Sales. From Contract/Temp to Contract-to-hire and Direct hire, Premier helps disruptive companies find the best talent to fuel the growth of their business.
results.name: Alley Boost Mixer (500+ RSVPs so far)

results.description:
The next Pints 'n' Purls meetup will be at W 3rd Common (1 W 3rd Street, between Broadway & Mercer) from 6-9 pm, drop in any time you like. Bring your knitting, crocheting, cross-stitching, or whatever else you're working on and prepare for a blast!

Feel free to call Amy (980/[masked]) with any questions. Hope to see you all there!

Note: Nearest subway stations are Astor Place, 8 St-NYU, Bleecker St, Broadway Lafayette, and W 4th. Happy Hour specials until 8pm which includes draft beer and wine. W 3rd Common accepts credit cards.

We hope that you will consider becoming or renewing your status as a "Pints 'n' Purls Contributor."  These voluntary dues help cover the costs of running the group, which include dues to Meetup.com, prizes for events, thank yous for hosts, etc.   ALL the money goes back into the group.  We are just hoping that you will share in some of the expenses that come out of organizing these fun and friendly events.  You can pay online or in person ($24/year- We organize over 70 meetups a year.)
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the back on the red couches, knitting, crocheting, needlepointing, etc...
results.name: PnP at W 3rd Common

Looking for a safe place to let your dog start some socializing?


Our safe, clean, secure indoor space gives your pup an early start on good dog-dog play and manners.
Moderated Play presented by EMPIRE of the DOG trainers.
VISIT US ON FACEBOOK too!

Feel free to come by in advance to check out the space, or drop in at 6:00 with your pup.

FREE FREE FREE
This play group happens EVERY* TUESDAY
*excluding holidays.

Please bring proof of whatever up to date vaccinations your dog has had.
We do reserve the right to refuse entry to dogs who appear unwell, or behaviorally inappropriate.This meetup is primarily for dogs who are not YET "street legal" so that they can safely socialize.

This is a Tuesday night institution and, as such, usually draws lots of interesting people and interesting bikes from our local NYC area motorcycle community.


Obviously we don't condone drinking and riding...so keep it casual, responsible, and sane. The Ear is also a great place to grab a table for dinner with friends.

This will be a recurring event on our calendar until the end of November...

group.name: NYC Triumph and Brit Bike Riders

results.description:
We love our newest venue in Westchester just outside of Harbor Island off Mamaroneck Avenue.  Here even the owner and his family play backgammon so we may have a keeper! 

Please join us for social play, tournament style play and "other" games.  Often we end the night with a chouette when we have a willing group.

3pt Round Robin for CBC Tournament Qualifier
Open Social Play

***FREE PARKING***

Bring your board and a friend (if you have them =) and join us for drinks and food at the new BAR HARBOR. Check them out at <a>www.barharborgrill.com.</a>

Extra boards will be available for those who do not have them!

Looking forward to seeing you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the boards in the front room, left of the bar

results.description:
The Best  Early Start Open Mic Around! Thank You Mike Walter Joe and all our Supporters at G&G. Great place, Great Food, Great Beer and Gifts for Beer Lovers.

Be careful about the GPS and the GOOGLE MAPs (If U haven't been yet) They may send U to Spring Valley! Take the Phone Number in case Your lost. (845)[masked]

Format The Same and Our Fearless Leader Jeff will Kick off the Night for us. We've been doing 3 tunes  and a Jam at the end of the night if there's time.

All Guitars and Instruments Welcome. Solid or Hollow Bodies, and Keyboards, Percussion  too!

Sign-up on the site and confirm your spot when you get there. First come first serve basis. Spots are 25.

results.description: Open House Tuesdays are hosted by autodidact and skill hoarder, Peter Hartmann.   Mingle, tinker, model, lase, 3d print, show, tell, learn, play, and ask questions. Most importantly, get inspired about a project! Peter Hartmann uses Arduino (and a whole bunch more) at work as an IT consultant and professional maker; bring your project & pick his brain.
results.name: Open House Tuesdays

results.description:
We will be meeting at Brookfield Place.  Cosi now closes early, but Brookfield is open all night.

There have been other meet ups at Brookfield. There is more than enough room for everyone.  Please update your RSVP if the location change is inconvenient.

We play Settlers the second Saturday, the third Sunday and the fourth Tuesday of every month. We play a mix of traditional (3-4 player) or expansion (5-6 player) Settlers as well as  Cities & Knights and/or Seafarers. We also play games from the Traders & Barbarians expansion set like Fishermen and Barbarians Newbies are always welcome. We'll teach you the game. If you have a board, please bring it. Also, to ensure that we have enough boards for all attendees, if you are planning on bringing a board please mention it in your RSVP. We look forward to playing with you!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the Palm trees.  We will be at tables on the second floor around the indoor palm trees. Look around for the Settlers of Catan Boards
results.name: Tuesday Night Settlers of Catan

group.name: NYC Settlers of Catan Meetup Group

results.description:
Network with a senior IT Recruiter and technology career coach for JP Morgan and your technology colleagues and learn how to effectively identify IT career goals, while enhancing your ability to fine tune your own. Participate in productive networking conversations designed to provide you with the tools necessary to communicate your value and target the best networking resources for you. 

If you are happy in your current role, and interested in moving up within your company, the is the place to understand how to create a road-map for internal mobility designed to improve visibility and recognition levels. If you are unemployed or unhappily employed, this is a forum to understand how to market yourself for future growth without misconceptions about your qualifications and related experience. 

Share hands-on knowledge from the recruiting and career coaching perspective and hear about challenges head hunters face while working with talented IT resources and the obstacles we overcome every day from the hiring side. Learn how to best represent yourself starting with the resume, your elevator pitch, how you respond to questions, what the best questions are for you to ask and some of the most effective methods to follow up. 

Knowledge is Power. We look forward to sharing!
results.how_to_find_us: Directly across from East 45th Street exit of Grand Central Station/Met Life Building
results.name: Discuss each person's skills, short/long term goals and actions to achieve them

group.name: New York Hacking Into Your Career Meetup

venue.address_1: Corner of East 14th St & University Pl
venue.name: Union Square Park

results.description:
SEO STUDY GROUP NEW YORK


This is an instructor-led, collaborative event.  There will be a presentation on SEO, and after that there will be time to work together on improving the SEO ranking of members' websites.

VENUE


We will meet in Union Square Park on the Corner of East 14th St and University Pl.  From there we will decide if we will stay in the park or pay $5 to rent a meeting room in a venue nearby.  Please vote on the discussion board about your preference.  

If we get enough votes in favor of the conference room, we will go there directly instead of the park.


PRESENTATION

HTML Structure in SEO

How to write powerful <title> tags.

How to write <h1> , <h2> , and <h3> tags to optimize your page.

Images in SEO

How to boost page rankings with images.

How give images effective image names and alt text that are SEO effective.

Social Media

Using Facebook to effectively improve your page rankings.

Building a link promotion network.

Anchored Keywords

Powers of Anchored Keywords.

Finding sites that are relevant to yours.

Virtually Outsourcing your SEO

How to train virtual workers to perform repetitive SEO tasks.

How to avoid scammers and spammers and find quality SEO workers.

DISCUSSION

Should your <title> tag be similar to your <h1> tag?


How many times should I post my link to get the most link power from Facebook?


How to find websites that will include anchored tags to your website on their pages?
results.name: SEO Study Group

results.description:
#ODSC meetup group is co-hosting this event with NYC Open Data Science Meetup and The New York Python Meetup Group.


Apply for Jan 2016  12 week full time Data Science Bootcamp to be a Data Scientist with NYC Data Science Academy.

Using Python at Scale for Data Science  - Wes McKinney

While Python is a de-facto language for modern data engineering and data science, Python development has been confined to local data processing—thereby limiting its users to smaller data sets. Historically, to address bigger data workloads, Python developers have had to extract samples or aggregates, forcing compromises in data fidelity, adding ETL costs, and ultimately leading to a loss of productivity and addressable use cases.

Ibis, a new open source data analytics framework for Python developers, has the goal of enabling the Python data ecosystem (NumPy, pandas, etc.) to operate efficiently at Hadoop scale. To enable high performance Python at scale without the age-old JVM interoperability problems, Ibis take advantage of unique synergies between Python and Impala, the leading open source MPP analytical query engine. In this talk, Ibis creator Wes McKinney, who was also the creator of pandas, will demo the current capabilities of Ibis as well as explain its roadmap.


Repurposing Existing Deep Learning Models: Image Similarity for fun (& profit?)

Hear how one data scientist spent an afternoon exploiting an existing trained deep learning model, extracting deep features, and transferring them in order to build an image-based similarity service for photographs of houses.

Rajat Arya will show you don't need to be an expert in deep learning or convolutional neural networks in order to leverage deep features in your next application.

results.description:
In this 2-hr fashion photography class our experienced instructors will assist you in exploring composition, studio and outdoor lighting, industry trends and the use of Photoshop in fashion images. Students are encouraged to bring fashion images to be analyzed and broken down during class time. Bring your camera with fresh batteries, and it's manuals if at hand. 

Requirements: Basic knowledge of aperture & shutter-speed are highly recommended but not necessary. Note, if you are looking to learn Studio Photography only, please refer to our ""Studio & Lighting seminar""

NOTE: Please only RSVP if you are certain you can make the event. There is a limited number of seats available and each RSVP gets booked one. Please cancel as soon as know you cannot make it to free up your place. Thank you!

See you there!

results.description:
We are co-hosting this event with #ODSC meetup group. Apply for Jan[masked] week full time Data science bootcamp to be a Data Scientist with NYC Data Science Academy.

Agenda: 
6:00p - 6:30p / Network & refreshments 
6:30p - 8:00p / Speaker time

Using Python at Scale for Data Science  - Wes McKinney

While Python is a de-facto language for modern data engineering and data science, Python development has been confined to local data processing—thereby limiting its users to smaller data sets. Historically, to address bigger data workloads, Python developers have had to extract samples or aggregates, forcing compromises in data fidelity, adding ETL costs, and ultimately leading to a loss of productivity and addressable use cases.

Ibis, a new open source data analytics framework for Python developers, has the goal of enabling the Python data ecosystem (NumPy, pandas, etc.) to operate efficiently at Hadoop scale. To enable high performance Python at scale without the age-old JVM interoperability problems, Ibis take advantage of unique synergies between Python and Impala, the leading open source MPP analytical query engine. In this talk, Ibis creator Wes McKinney, who was also the creator of pandas, will demo the current capabilities of Ibis as well as explain its roadmap.


Repurposing Existing Deep Learning Models: Image Similarity for fun (& profit?)


Hear how one data scientist spent an afternoon exploiting an existing trained deep learning model, extracting deep features, and transferring them in order to build an image-based similarity service for photographs of houses.


Rajat Arya will show you don't need to be an expert in deep learning or convolutional neural networks in order to leverage deep features in your next application.


The presentation will be entirely delivered from an IPython Notebook and written in Python, using Dato for extracting deep features from a trained deep learning model and deploying the image similarity service.


After a dozen years of building scalable systems at AWS, Microsoft, AddThis, and Dato, Rajat recently started working more closely with data scientists, helping them build intelligent applications using Dato.
results.name: Using Python at Scale for Data Science  - Wes McKinney  While Python is a de-fac

results.description:
Moderator: Steven Kuyan

Steven Kuyan is Managing Director of Incubators and Entrepreneurship at the NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering. He co-founded and is responsible for managing two of the three incubators located at Varick Street in Soho and DUMBO in Brooklyn. On campus, Steven develops strategic initiatives to accelerate innovation at the University through programs that catalyze student innovation. 


Speakers:

Adam Jay Harrison

Building the National Security Technology Accelerator

The Department of Defense is building a National Security Technology Accelerator (NSTA) to engage innovators and entrepreneurs in the development of technologies and ventures relevant to national security. This talk will provide an overview of the NSTA and describe some of the services it will offer.

Adam Jay Harrison is a long-time defense entrepreneur and change agent, having led [masked]) one of the first rapid acquisition organizations established by the Department of Defense in the aftermath of the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001. Under his leadership, the U.S. Army Technical Operations Support Activity earned an unprecedented three consecutive Army Greatest Invention awards [masked]) for delivering life-saving solutions to the front lines of conflict in Iraq, Afghanistan, and around the world.

In 2006, Jay founded Mav6, LLC, one of the fastest growing defense technology companies in the U.S. At Mav6 he led the development of the M1400 airship, the largest and most energy efficient unmanned aircraft in history - a product recognized in 2011 by Popular Science Magazine as a top 100 innovation of the year. In 2012, Ernst and Young named Jay “Entrepreneur of the Year” for the Gulf Coast region. 

Speakers Presenting Requirements:

David H. Rios, LNO at U.S. Central Command, DTIC-IAC Field Representative, J8 S&T, USCENTCOM

Steve Sharkey, IAC LNO to Northcom, DoD Information Analysis Centers (IACs)

Timothy Fowler, IAC LNO to USSTRATCOM


Ramsey Meyer, NPS JFIX

Brett Scharringhausen, USCENTCOM CCJ8-Science & Technology Chief, Discovery & Integration
results.name: NSTA - Building the National Security Technology Accelerator & Requirements

results.description: Oktoberfest at Pilsener Haus ( http://www.PilsenerHaus.com ) in Hoboken, NJ. Happy Hour Half Price Entire Menu Food and Drinks until Midnight. results.description:
GROW TOUR ~ Empowerment for Women ~ Staten Island 


Presented by Powerful You! Women’s Network

It’s a Fact: Growth in any area of your life brings growth to all other areas of your life – including your business. This Grow Tour is all about growth … your growth.

The Grow Tour is designed to inspire, motivate and empower women to live as Conscious and Abundant Creators of their lives and businesses. 

We know that one small shift makes a huge difference over the course of time. This event provides opportunities for many small shifts, personal, business and spiritual growth, and exposure to unlimited and creative thinking.  This dynamic gathering brings together inspiring and powerful women.

This event includes 5 incredible expert speakers, vendors, a Real Connections networking session, buffet dinner and door prizes. Join us for this powerful tour event to celebrate your growth. Save the date: Tuesday evening, September 29th at Mansion Grand in Staten Island.

Here’s the incredible speaker lineup:

Sue Urda – Author, Speaker, Inspirer and Co-Founder of Powerful You! Women’s Network. Topic: Being Powerful You!  ~ Tapping the essence of your most powerful self for business growth, abundance and inner peace.

Roe Couture DeSaro – Gutsy Gal Guide, Bestselling Author, and Speaker. Topic: Awaken Your Inner Gutsy Gal ~ 3 Steps to Clarity, Confidence and Cash

Luba Winegardner – Your Partner in Insurance and Retirement Planning. Topic: Financial Freedom ~ What It Really Means and How You Can Have It!

Renai Ellison – The “On-Camera Coach” – Topic: Reveal Your Excellence- Tap Into Your Passion, Potential, and Purpose.

Lisa Allen – Personal Leadership and Transition Coach. Topic: Focus. Action. Success. ~ 3 Ingredients to Mastering Your Time.

We are grateful for our premier sponsor AlphaZelle. Additional sponsorships are available for the event.

Register today and bring your girlfriends and colleagues to share this incredible experience. Early Bird pricing saves $20 and ends September 21st. 

When Amazing Women Come Together, All Things are Possible.

FOR MORE INFO & TO REGISTER visit www.grow-tour.com/events/si-ny/

results.description:
Enjoy a 'wine buffet' of Champagnes, Sparklers, Ports, Dessert Wines, Big Cabernets, and Spicy Red Wines from all over the world that pair perfectly with bites of dark, milk, or white chocolate bites. 

A fun, indulgent, delicious way to celebrate the perfect match of 24 wines with brownies, cookies, nuts & fruits, chocolate truffles, & chocolate noshes!

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Tickets start at just $29 and will go up to $35 as event gets closer. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Sep-29-2015_at_0630PM

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited and this will sell out. Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Sep-29-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Chocolate! (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Tickets start at just $29 and will go up to $35 as event gets closer.

results.description:
Come out and play some games, hang out, have fun and may be make some new friends.


This is a co-event with the Queens NYC Board Games Meetup. So there will be more people than you see on this group RSVP list. Average attendee count is 10-15 people.

Leave a comment if you are bringing or want to play any game. It's totally OK if you do not bring anything. We'll most likely have enough games for everyone to play. If you are new to games, we'll teach you how to play. New-comers are always welcome.

The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there. Please support them by making purchases of food & drink while we are using their establishment. We want to keep a good relationship with them so we can continue to meet up there.


Note: On occasions the Steinway Billiard Cafe has special events or is simply too crowded to accommodate our group, we would move to the Panera Bread a block away on 35th Ave.


If you want to join our board game Facebook group to connect with other gamers, please join us here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for boxes of board games
results.name: Geek & Sundry Tuesday board game meet up

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday 6:30-8:30 all summer long! Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.

Intercambio is free and all skill levels are welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange

group.name: El Centro, volunteer led language classes in Midtown

results.description:
Food. Drink. Spark! Come meet the spark authors the first night of strata for a deep dive into 1.5. [NOTE: please register here http://www.meetup.com/New-York-Spark-Meetup/events/225041216/ so that we have one list to manage. Apologies for the inconvenience. -Matt]

Spark 1.5 was recently released. In this meetup, join TD, Patrick, Reynold from Databricks and Dean from Typesafe to talk about the latest release and what is coming next.
Many of the major changes in Spark 1.5 are under-the-hood changes to improve Spark’s performance, usability, and operational stability. Spark 1.5 ships major pieces of Project Tungsten, an initiative focused on increasing Spark’s performance through several low-level architectural optimizations. The release also adds operational features for the streaming component, such as backpressure support. Another major theme of this release is data science: Spark 1.5 ships several new machine learning algorithms and utilities, and extends Spark’s new R API with distributed GLM.
We will give a high level intro of the release, dive into Project Tungsten and Spark Streaming, and discuss future plans.

Speakers:
Tathagata Das, Patrick Wendell, Reynold Xin, Databricks
Dean Wampler, Ph.D. (@deanwampler) leads the Big Data efforts at Typesafe, focusing on Spark, Mesos, Hadoop, Akka, and other tools. He is the author of "Programming Scala, Second Edition" and "Functional Programming for Java Developers", and the co-author of "Programming Hive", all from O'Reilly. Dean is a contributor to several open source projects and he co-organizes and speaks at many technology conferences and Chicago-based user groups.

Mingling from 6:30-7 and again from 8-9.
results.name: Committer night: spark 1.5 and beyond [see description to register]

results.description:
This month, we'll learn a framework to design for greater influence and action, then learn how to apply it by workshopping group members' own tech designs as a group!


We're thrilled that Brian Cugelman, PhD, founder of the digital behavior research firm AlterSpark, will be returning to lead this workshop. Brian's talk at our March event was phenomenally popular, and we're so excited to have him back to share his Cugelman influence model and show how it can be applied to our own work. 

Want to volunteer your tech for review? Share a URL or screenshot of a single landing page or mobile app in a comment on this event page or send it to [masked].

______________________________ 

Here’s the agenda for the evening: 

6:30 PM: Drinks, snacks, and socializing.

7:00: Introduction and presentation from Brian, followed by the workshop. 

8:00: Q&A with the audience.

8:15: Community announcements. If you’re hiring, want to tell us about an awesome event coming up, or have anything else to tell the Action Design community, let everyone know!

8:30: More drinks, snacks, and socializing.

A huge thank you to Alexander Interactive for hosting us!

See you there! 

____________________________________________________


In addition to this free Action Design workshop, Brian is leading a 2-day workshop on digital behavior change, Monday 9/28 - Tuesday, 9/29 in NYC.  Action Design members get a 10% discount with the code NYC_ACTION_DESIGN_10

____________________________________________________
results.name: Workshop on Digital Design for Action with Brian Cugelman, PhD

results.description:
Working on a startup or have a new product idea? Perhaps you're iterating an existing product? The Product Council is for you! Join us each month to learn from the experience of other product owners.


About this month's event: 
This month we are focusing on video sharing products. See below for more details:


Featured Product: Vimeo
Vimeo was founded in 2004 by a group of filmmakers who wanted to share their creative work and personal moments from their lives. Today, Vimeo continues to be the home for high-quality videos and the people who love them.


Featured Startup: Katch.me
Record Periscopes and Meerkats with one tweet! Use #katch to get an 'automagic' replay link when your stream ends.


This month's Product Council:

• Sara Poorsattar, Director of Video Products at The New York Times (LinkedIn)

• Christophe Gillet, Director of Audience Product at Vimeo (LinkedIn)

• Max Stossel, Creator & Storyteller at Words That Move (LinkedIn)

-----

View photos from past events:
http://www.meetup.com/Product-Council-NYC/photos/

----


What is the Product Council?

“User has opportunity to exchange stories, network, and learn valuable lessons from seasoned product veterans.”

The Product Council provides startups and existing companies a fresh new outlet for critical feedback, ideation, and improvement of their products. Each month an audience of product managers, designers and founders gather to learn valuable lessons and insights from experienced product owners as they dive deep into the challenge, success and failure of product design. This is no demo or pitch, rather it’s an open examination of how to execute an idea.

Ever wonder what it’s like to actually sit on the Product Council? Look no further, one of our product council members documented his experience here, “Ouch, Product Feedback”.

----

What other people are saying: 

“The Meetup was excellent. As a product manager of an early-stage startup with less than one-year in the role, I have iterated on both our product and business processes to ensure that we meet success criteria. The challenges of the early-stage company, MotionTraxx, and tactics used by this month's growth company, Spotify, was very helpful in helping me extract lessons learned. In learning about practical approaches to product management, I'm able to better utilize my own product management toolbox to further develop an effective, productive and efficient product management system for our company. Thanks and I look forward to future council meetups.” - Eric C.

----

Twitter feed w/ photos:
https://twitter.com/search?q=PCNYC

results.description:
Food.  Drink.  Spark!

Spark 1.5 was recently released. In this meetup, join TD, Patrick, Reynold from Databricks and Dean from Typesafe to talk about the latest release and what is coming next.
Many of the major changes in Spark 1.5 are under-the-hood changes to improve Spark’s performance, usability, and operational stability. Spark 1.5 ships major pieces of Project Tungsten, an initiative focused on increasing Spark’s performance through several low-level architectural optimizations. The release also adds operational features for the streaming component, such as backpressure support. Another major theme of this release is data science: Spark 1.5 ships several new machine learning algorithms and utilities, and extends Spark’s new R API with distributed GLM.
We will give a high level intro of the release, dive into Project Tungsten and Spark Streaming, and discuss future plans.

Speakers:
Tathagata Das, Patrick Wendell, Reynold Xin, Databricks
Dean Wampler, Ph.D. (@deanwampler) leads the Big Data efforts at Typesafe, focusing on Spark, Mesos, Hadoop, Akka, and other tools. He is the author of "Programming Scala, Second Edition" and "Functional Programming for Java Developers", and the co-author of "Programming Hive", all from O'Reilly. Dean is a contributor to several open source projects and he co-organizes and speaks at many technology conferences and Chicago-based user groups.

  Mingling from 6:30-7 and again from 8-9.

results.description:
Machine learning methods are being applied in many different areas - from analyzing financial stock markets to movie recommender engines. But the same methods can be applied to other areas that also deal with big messy data. In bioinformatics I use similar machine learning, only this time to help find the underlying mechanisms of cancer.

The problems in bioinformatics might seem opaque and confusing - sequencing, DNA, methylation, ChIP-seq, motifs etc. But underneath, the same algorithms that are used to find groups of customers based on their buying behavior can be used to find subtypes of cancer that respond differently to treatments. Algorithms for text analysis can be used to find important patterns in DNA strands. And software verification tools can help analyze biological systems.

In this talk, I'll show you the exciting world of machine learning applications in bioinformatics. No knowledge of biology is required, the talk will be mostly in developer-speak.

Evelina is a machine learning researcher working in bioinformatics, trying to reverse-engineer cancer at University of Cambridge. Her background is mainly in computer science, statistics and machine learning. Evelina is a big fan of F# and uses it frequently for data manipulation and exploratory analysis in her research. Outside of academia, she also speaks at developer conferences and user groups about using F# for data science. She writes a blog at http://www.evelinag.com.

results.description:
Everyone Pays Tuition

Many people aspire to trade. It takes smarts, work, finding a lens through which to view the market and choosing basic trading principles to follow. Next is determining what instruments to trade and a trade style. Following this is adopting or creating one or more strategies to trade these instruments, and determining tactics to implement these strategies.

Next in line is paper trading to gain comfort with your tactics, process and execution, then low position-size real money trading. You should then earn the right to trade higher; only then can you can scale up with an eye towards your trading goals, which also need to be quantified. Paramount throughout is risk management.

Like the markets, the path to progress doesn't follow a straight line and is not without numerous hiccups. There are revelations and light-bulb moments, setbacks and moments of existential angst. Isn't this just supposed to be "Buy low, Sell high?"

When it comes to people, one should generally avoid saying human behavior is "always this" and "never that." Though it's pretty close to 100% certainty that successful traders always go through everything above and that it's never easy or a continuous upswing without a pullback.


But while the general progress scenario is the same from one trader to another, the specific path each takes varies. What one person does, the time it takes, and in what proportions varies from someone else's experience. Specific elements that differ are:

• seeking out free and premium trading education in the form of in-person classes and extended web-based programs

• seeking out free and premium self-study from trading books, magazines and websites and webinars

• joining an online traderoom

• opting to first learn and understand a core set of trading principles, or eliminating that step and trying to fast-track the process by immediately adopting a strategy and tactics to trade sooner

• the level of patience one has in order to trade for significant money at the appropriate time, not before

• the overall time and effort one expends in the journey

• whether the effort is a solitary effort or done in concert with others

• the person's emotional makeup

• the inevitable, initial trading losses as one moves the theory into action and takes the body blows and lumps the market dishes out.

Here in the traderoom we refer to all of this as "paying tuition to the market." Everyone "pays to play", i.e., incurs costs in learning to trade, and when we say "costs" it doesn't just mean money. Costs take the form of many "currencies" and also raise the issue of how long "payments" go on progressing from novice to competent. Those that are successful plan their educational path and practical experience so that  their "tuition" doesn't deplete their reserves of time, money, energy and emotional stability.

Join us at Precision Trading Labs as Ryan Nocera and Mitch Firestone talk about all of this in detail, discuss ways to reduce your tuition and get "financial aid," and "create your own scholarship." We'll relate personal experiences in how we intelligently allocated our resources and controlled our own tuition payments while progressing to us both supporting ourselves and our families exclusively through trading.

Please join us at the traderoom Tuesday Sept 29 at 6:30pm.

Hope to see you here!

Hi, Financial Freedom Seekers! 

Welcome to our first meetup group. I am really grateful to have met some mission-driven financial educators who are passionate about helping families and individuals get financially fit earlier this year.  Because so many of us are living paycheck to paycheck, and are one disaster from losing our lifesavings, I cannot be more thrilled to have you join me on this journey to get financially fit.  I intentionally pick a non-restaurant space for us to meet with respect to people who are already on a budget. 

In this Meetup, we will learn the wealth formula and how quick/slow our wealth and debt doubles.  Are you ready to face the truth of how financially fit or unfit we are? 

The promise of this group is that we will listen to one another, to understand each other's situation in a non-judgmental way, to learn financial concept from guest speakers and to discuss how we can apply ways to improve our financial situation--one step at a time.  This is not a one-time quick fix.  If you see value in this meetup, we would love to see you at every meeting as each meeting will have a different topic focus.  If you know of anybody who would benefit from this learning, please spread the love and words. 

Looking forward to meeting every one of you!

Pei

results.description:
For our first meetup let's start with a roundtable discussion about the direction of the group. We were excited to see so many people join and want to hear your ideas for talks and events.

We created this group to discuss ways to use disruptive (new) technology and design for good. But we'd like to get a clearer idea about what that means to you. 

Our organization, Library For All, considers regions where cheap technology is prevalent, yet internet infrastructure remains fragile and cellular data charges high.  Our eReader platform provides locally-sourced books to Android devices where they can be read offline. We use a  lightweight noSQL data synchronization model (couchDB) and physical on-site micro-servers (raspberryPi).

We by no means want to limit our discussions and events to highly technical things; rather, we want to create a space for collaboration and exchange of ideas around using technology and design for good causes.

Food and drinks will be provided. See you there!
results.name: Using disruptive technology to reach the developing world

results.description:
By Dr. Thomas Wiecki, Data Science Lead at Quantopian 

Python is quickly establishing itself as the lingua franca for quantitative finance. The rich stack of open source tools like Pandas, the Jupyter notebook, and Seaborn, provide quants with a rich and powerful tool belt to analyze financial data. While useful for Quantitative Finance, these general purpose libraries lack support for common financial analyses like the computation of certain risk factors (Sharpe, Fama-French), or plots of portfolio allocations over time. 

Pyfolio is a recent open source tool developed by Quantopian to fill this gap. At the core of pyfolio is a so-called tear sheet that consists of various individual plots that provide a comprehensive image of the performance of a trading algorithm/portfolio. In addition, the library features advanced statistical analyses using Bayesian modeling. The software can be used stand-alone, with our open-source backtesting library Zipline and is available on the Quantopian platform. 

This talk will be a tutorial of how to get the most out of this library (http://quantopian.github.io/pyfolio/).

Pizza and drinks will be served. 

Speaker Details:

Thomas Wiecki is the data science lead at Quantopian Inc. where he uses probabilistic programming to help build a crowd-sourced hedge fund. He holds a Ph.D. from Brown University. As a recognized international speaker, Thomas has given talks at various conferences and meet-ups across the US (including New York, Boston, Chicago, and San Francisco), Europe (London, Berlin, Luxembourg, and Düsseldorf), as well as Asia (Singapore). Among other open source projects, he is involved in the development of PyMC — a probabilistic programming framework written in Python.

By Dr. Thomas Wiecki, Data Science Lead at Quantopian 

Python is quickly establishing itself as the lingua franca for quantitative finance. The rich stack of open source tools like Pandas, the Jupyter notebook, and Seaborn, provide quants with a rich and powerful tool belt to analyze financial data. While useful for Quantitative Finance, these general purpose libraries lack support for common financial analyses like the computation of certain risk factors (Sharpe, Fama-French), or plots of portfolio allocations over time. 

Pyfolio is a recent open source tool developed by Quantopian to fill this gap. At the core of pyfolio is a so-called tear sheet that consists of various individual plots that provide a comprehensive image of the performance of a trading algorithm/portfolio. In addition, the library features advanced statistical analyses using Bayesian modeling. The software can be used stand-alone, with our open-source backtesting library Zipline and is available on the Quantopian platform. 

This talk will be a tutorial of how to get the most out of this library (http://quantopian.github.io/pyfolio/).

Pizza and drinks will be served. 

Speaker Details:

Thomas Wiecki is the data science lead at Quantopian Inc. where he uses probabilistic programming to help build a crowd-sourced hedge fund. He holds a Ph.D. from Brown University. As a recognized international speaker, Thomas has given talks at various conferences and meet-ups across the US (including New York, Boston, Chicago, and San Francisco), Europe (London, Berlin, Luxembourg, and Düsseldorf), as well as Asia (Singapore). Among other open source projects, he is involved in the development of PyMC — a probabilistic programming framework written in Python.
results.how_to_find_us: Eisner & Lubin Auditorium, 4th Floor
results.name: Portfolio and Risk Analytics in Python with pyfolio

results.description:
(Todd Lipcon is in town for Strata + Hadoop World NYC 2015 and will arrive equipped with the following talk )

Over the past several years, the Hadoop ecosystem has made great strides in its real-time access capabilities, narrowing the gap compared to traditional database technologies. With systems such as Impala and Spark, analysts can now run complex queries or jobs over large datasets within a matter of seconds. With systems such as Apache HBase and Apache Phoenix, applications can achieve millisecond-scale random access to arbitrarily-sized datasets.

Despite these advances, some important gaps remain that prevent many applications from transitioning to Hadoop-based architectures. Users are often caught between a rock and a hard place: columnar formats such as Apache Parquet offer extremely fast scan rates for analytics, but little to no ability for real-time modification or row-by-row indexed access. Online systems such as HBase offer very fast random access, but scan rates that are too slow for large scale data warehousing workloads.

This talk will investigate the trade-offs between real-time transactional access and fast analytic performance from the perspective of storage engine internals. It will also describe Kudu, the new addition to the open source Hadoop ecosystem that fills the gap described above, complementing HDFS and HBase to provide a new option to achieve fast scans and fast random access from a single API.

Speaker:
Todd Lipcon is a Software Engineer at Cloudera and a PMC member of the Apache Hadoop and Apache HBase projects. He holds a Sc.B in computer science from Brown University, where he completed an honors thesis developing a new collaborative filtering algorithm for the Netflix Prize Competition. Todd interned at Google, where he developed machine learning methods to detect credit card fraud on AdWords and Google Checkout.
results.name: Kudu: Resolving Transactional Access/Analytic Perf Trade-offs in Hadoop
