results.description:
This September, we are partnering with the organizers of the GothamGo conference (GDG discount available with the code go2015kickoff</a>) to run a special event on <a href="https://golang.org/">the Go Programming Language. While we welcome developers with all levels of experience in golang, we plan to make the agenda beginner friendly.


AGENDA:

5:30pm   Doors Open


6:00pm  Featured Talk: "Introduction to Go" 

Abstract:   Learn about the origins of Go, and what makes it special. We'll talk about the community around it, the design philosophy that drives the language, a glimpse at the language itself, and a(n abbreviated) survey of the ecosystem. 

Bio: Sean Swehla is currently a Senior Software Engineer at DigitalOcean. He has worked in front-end, back-end, and middleware, in industries ranging from healthcare to disaster management to telecommunications. In his free time he likes to make anything electronic, play with liquid nitrogen, and encourage makers of all types at Squidwrench in Highland, NY

7:00pm  "Go can make you better at your job, if you let it."  

Abstract:  Go is not-so-quietly asking us to make some serious changes to the way we programmers think about software architecture. Some of those changes go against long-held beliefs in the field of computer science. This talk outlines how Go's approach can be abstracted to help us be not just better programmers, but better at our jobs in general.

Speaker Bio: Brendan O'Brien is the CTO of Ivy, a startup in the Fashion & Modeling industry. He's been writing Go for 3 years, or roughly long enough to make all the silly mistakes. When Brendan's not writing writing Go, he's thinking about the role programmers & technology play in the world. When he's not doing any of those things, he's working on this talk, or something else.

7:30 pm  "Deploying a Go app using Docker"

Abstract: Docker provides a lightweight way of building, testing and deploying applications on a variety of clouds. But it really shines during development where it can be used locally to quickly build/test your stack.


Speaker Bio: Ajai Khattri is aPolyglot web/mobile developer and sys admin with over 20 years experience working in very small startups and large companies. Currently building a mobile social messaging startup in NYC.

8:00pm Lightning Talks

(Preview) "Firebase + Polymer" (Ralph Yozzo)

Ralph will do a shorter version(preview) of a longer talk he is working on that will showcase the use of a Polymer front-end with Firebase. The talk will cover concepts like Firebase usage, security and data structuring.


8:30pm Wrap-up & Doors Close


RESOURCES:

• Tour Of Go -- official GoLang tutorial

• IO 2014 Codelab -- build a backend on App Engine


• Polymer-Gopher -- Polymer, Google Cloud, AppEngine & Go


• Google APIs for Go -- Getting Started (github)


• Golang Playground


• Go Code Sample -- YouTube, G+, Google Identity Toolkit

CALL FOR HACKERS

http://bit.ly/firehack-gdg-2015
results.name: Sep GDG Meetup: GoLang Workshop w/GothamGo

results.description:
A discussion led by the Tax Incentive Panel at Media Services. Should be great information for all producers, those looking to raise capital for films, and those just trying to learn the film finance game. RSVP THROUGH THIS LINK:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-state-of-film-production-incentives-tickets-18301210413?aff=es2

Film & TV production incentives have become a game changer in our industry. With some states offering over 35% in state tax credits and rebates, it's just good business to do your due diligence on the available incentives, to make sure you're getting your production dollars up on the screen where they belong.

And there are more factors to consider than just the size of the credit. Is it refundable or transferable, and if so, how do you broker a transfer? These questions and more will be explored in this informative discussion. We invite you to stay with us after the panel for light refreshments and networking. Attendance is free but limited, so RSVP now to reserve your place!

More about the event...

Hosted By Media Services and Film Incentives Group Featuring:

Welcome: Steve Bizenov, VP of Sales and Software Development - Media Services

Moderator: Verlette Franck, Tax Incentive Specialist - Media Services

Mike McCann & Meghan McCullough - Film Incentives Group

David Brauer - CPA, Los Angeles

Lora Butler - Vice President, State Tax Planning & Developnebt at Discovery Communications

Stephen Hamner - Director, Louisiana Film

Daniel Hank - Vice President of Production Company

Ed Ruggiero - Tax Credit Administrator at Connecticut Office of Film, TV, & Digital Media

Constance McFeely - NYS Film Office Peter Stathopoulos, Esq. - State Tax Incentives and Entertainment Attorney Atlanta, GA

*Current Tax Incentive programs around the country will be discussed and all of your questions will be answered!
results.name: The State of Film Production Incentives

Learn how to have the best road-map for your style and goals.

Topics covered include: how to have realistic expectations if you're currently employed yet unfulfilled or seeking more compensation, interested in gaining internal mobility, or out of work. Presented by Steven Davis, Managing Director Renaissance Solutions, Inc.

Steven Davis has coached thousands of business and technology professionals for over 20 years as Practice Director in global technology recruiting firms and as a Career Counselor and Coach. His strengths include improving upward mobility and making a difference in careers. Three areas of focus 1) recruiting, 2) career coaching and consulting for companies such as JP Morgan Chase and 3) building his private practice coaching business. Steven calls upon strong analytical abilities combined with a desire to empower professionals to fulfill career objectives. He always has the “best path to success” by customizing solutions as they relate to each job seeker or coaching client. He's also a Coach for the JPMorgan Chase Expert Engineer (E2) Program, which is a key leadership program aimed at developing and retaining top performing technical talent across the global Investment Bank Technology group.

results.description:
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment is required athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5903 is required .</a> 
 $30-$35 depending on how early you register.

results.description:
Join TiE New York and WeWork for a Fireside Chat with Entrepreneur, Investor and Author Vinay Trivedi!

SPACE IS LIMITED: to confirm your attendance register HERE
*This event will include networking, Q & A, and refreshments

Vinay Trivedi is an entrepreneur, investor, and tech enthusiast. He has a background in venture capital and private equity at Blackstone and has worked in product marketing, growth, and analytics at Locu, a venture-backed tech startup acquired by GoDaddy. Prior to Locu, he served as a team member on a TED fellow-led education technology challenge called ‘Future of the Book’ and founded a national non-profit organization called SeniorLink, a youth volunteer agency for teaching seniors about computers and the Internet. Passionate about supporting innovation, Vinay is actively involved in The Blackstone Charitable Foundation’s Entrepreneurship Initiative to help strengthen entrepreneurial ecosystems around the US, and helps promote STEM education initiatives and public policy in New York. He is the author of How to Speak Tech, a book which explains the basic technologies and terms of Internet, which he presented at SXSW 2014. Vinay earned the Congressional Award Gold Medal in Washington, DC for his work in technology education and community service. He received his A.B. (Honors) in Computer Science from Harvard University, where he graduated Phi Beta Kappa and as a John Harvard Scholar, Weissman Scholar, and Detur Book Prize Winner.


Date: Wednesday, September 30th
Time: 6:00 PM
Location: WeWork: 205 East 42nd Street
REGISTER HERE

“WeWork is a community for creators. We transform buildings into beautiful, collaborative workspaces and provide infrastructure, services, events and technology so our members can focus on doing what they love. We currently have 50 locations in sixteen cities with over 30,000 members. Book a tour today at
www.wework.com”

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
We’re meeting up for a free Happy Hour: A Closer Look at Greed on Wednesday, Sept. 30, from 6-8pm.  It’s a great way to meet fellow actors, screenwriters, and performing artists who wish to gain psychological insights to improve their character-building skills and acting technique.  

"If we loved something - like cream cakes or particular people -why would we want too much of it? Well, we might fear losing it and never having it again, so we might believe that we need to take it all and hoard it for ever; that because it could go away, or run out, or someone else could take it, we had better get as much as we can. Or we may become greedy because what we are getting is not quite what we want : it's failing to satisfy me so I begin to believe that more is better, that if one cream cake isn't doing the trick, three will, when in fact it isn't a cream cake that I really want. "

I’ll be distributing handouts and discussion questions on greed and the meanings that money and possessions can have in people’s lives. We’ll develop insights that can help you create more a nuanced portrayal of greed in your characters.


Please RSVP on the Meetup page. Look forward to seeing you there.

When: Wednesday, Sept. 30, from 6-8pm

Where: Adalya Bar and Restaurant

55 Irving Place (betw. 17th and 18th St.). Close to Union Square.

** Happy Hour specials until 7pm: $5 select draft beers and white wine. **
results.how_to_find_us: Adalya is diagonally across the street from Pete's Tavern on Irving Place. It is close to Union Square. We will be at or near the bar. The bartender will know which group we are.
results.name: Happy Hour:  A Closer Look at Greed

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

results.description:
Now celebrating its 53rd year, the New York Film Festival—running Sep 25–Oct 11—highlights the best in world cinema, featuring premieres, newly restored classics, special events, filmmaker talks, and more. 

The New York Film Group is pleased to support the Film Society of Lincoln Center's special screening (and North America premiere!) of Noah Baumbach and Jake Paltrow's new documentary, De Palma. This documentary is about Brian De Palma discussing his own work and his influences.

This fleet and bountiful film portrait by Noah Baumbach and Jake Paltrow covers the life and career of the great iconoclast of American cinema: the man who gave us Carrie, Dressed to Kill, Blow Out, and Carlito’s Way." It’s an insightful and often hilarious tour through American movie making from the 1960's to the present, and a primer on how movies are made and unmade. It’s a surprising, lively, and unexpectedly moving portrait of a great, irascible, unapologetic, and uncompromising New York artist. http://www.filmlinc.org/nyff2015/films/de-palma/

The screening will take place on September 30th at 6:00 pm, Lincoln Center - Alice Tully Hall.


Brian De Palma and the filmmakers will be on hand to discuss the film. The New York Film Group will continue hanging out and networking after the screening at PJ Clarke's by Lincoln Center at 9:00 pm - 44 West 63rd Street. http://www.pjclarkes.com/lincoln-square/.

We look forward to seeing you there!

TJ Collins

NYFG Co-Founder & Organizer

www.newyorkfilmgroup.com

www.facebook.com/Newyorkfilmgroup
results.name: Special premiere of a new documentary "De Palma" with Brian De Palma in person

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
This is a night dedicated to the newcomers. Maybe you're new to Node.js or maybe you just need a refresher. We've got an AWESOME night lined up for you. Two talks, one night!

Node.js Fundamentals


Learn the fundamentals of creating and navigating a Node.js app — from how clients connect to servers to breaking large apps into modules. Frontend developers will leave knowing how to get their bearings in a Node project and what to learn next in Node.


By:

Cameron is an engineer building with React and Node at Thinkful, a company that provides engineer-to-engineer training for web and mobile developers at the fastest growing tech companies.

Building RESTful API with Node.js


In this talk we will be covering how Nodes.js and Express.js framework can be used to write RESTFul APIs. First, we’ll learn Node.js basics and cover NPM and how to install and use packages in your application.

Next, we'll cover what RESTFul APIs are this approach helps design better APIs.

Finally, we'll run through the demo, showing example of hypermedia driven RESTFul API built with Node.js.

This workshop is perfect if you have a basic understanding of Javascript and want to improve your knowledge so that you can start creating RESTFul API endpoints to support your Web and Mobile applications.

By:

Srdjan is an entrepreneur and technologist focused on software architecture, product development, and team building. He is currently Technical Principal at ThoughtWorks, before Srdjan was CTO of venture-backed startup Cignium, and lead technologist for customer acquisition agency Tranzact.

He writes and speaks about software architecture and emerging technologies, and tweets @djidja8
results.name: Node.js Newcomers Night!

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE:  RSVP HERE IS A VOTE OF CONFIDENCE + WE APPRECIATE IT! CLICK HERE TO RSVP ON THE AIANY SITE.

FutureNOW explores current and future trends in the architectural industry. Recently, economic upturn has improved business for the A/E/C industry; for the first time since the recession, there is a growing demand for architectural services. Firms are now bidding for new business, expanding service, diversifying offerings, and growing their talent and teams. During the recession, a declining employment market made it difficult for emerging professionals to find and hold jobs. Today, this gap in talent, skills, and industry demand has defined a new problem - ‘a missing a generation of architects.’ How are architectural firms shifting their people strategy to bridge the talent gap and appeal to a new generation - their skills, workstyles, and professional expectations?

This critical moment represents a dual opportunity. With the market favoring employees, now is the time for emerging professionals to leverage their skills and offerings to more strategically shape their career, prove their value and influence, and effect change in the industry’s people policies - from compensation and benefits to learning and professional development. At the same time, firms must deploy a ‘get ahead, stay ahead’ people strategy to future-proof their talent and their business.

This panel will explore emergent trends in the current and future hiring market, focusing on the critical opportunity for employers and emerging talent to re-assess and re-value their current strategies.

Panelists:

Tim Milam joined FXFOWLE in 2001 and was promoted to Partner in 2004. He has more than 25 years of experience as an architect and manager in both the public and private sectors. In his role as Managing Director, Tim is responsible for general management of the firm with a focus on strategic planning and operations.  His duties include contract negotiations, project management oversight, and recruiting, and he is responsible for the firm’s mentoring, training, and professional development initiatives for employees.  He is also a key member of the firm's management committee.
Before joining FXFOWLE, Tim was a Project Manager at the City University of New York (CUNY) in the Department of Design, Construction & Management. For CUNY, he was responsible for the oversight of all projects at several college campuses.  He is a LEED-accredited professional, a registered architect, and member of the AIA. Tim received a Bachelor of Architecture from the University of Kentucky and a Master of Urban Planning from City College of New York.

Everett Hollander is the Operations Director of BIG NYC, where he is responsible for the general management of BIG’s New York City office. His purview includes office management/operations, human resources, legal coordination, project controlling and organization development. Since joining BIG in January 2013, his focus has been on streamlining operations at the high-growth, global firm; BIG NYC has grown from 50 to more than 180 employees since Everett joined BIG. Prior to joining BIG, Everett was the Operations Manager at REX where he focused on establishing and realigning business practices. Everett received a B.Arch with Honors from the University of Texas at Austin, where he was the recipient of the AIA Henry Adams Certificate. While Everett’s professional emphasis is business operations, he remains actively involved in NYC’s design community; he assisted taught two design-based courses at NYU’s Gallatin School for Individualized Study and he hosted the symposia “Urban by Nature” at the BMW Guggenheim Lab in New York City.


Brynnemarie Lanciotti is an Assistant Project Manager for SLCE Architects, LLP. She transitioned to SLCE in January 2015 to expand her project base and to enhance her technical skills, rounding out her 10 year professional experience.
Brynnemarie moved to New York City in 2008 to further develop her career. During the recession, while maintaining her full-time position at Franke, Gottsegen, Cox Architects, Brynnemarie began her involvement with AIA NY Emerging New York Architects (ENYA), while simultaneously taking her licensing exams. She took on the roles as ENYA Co-Chair from[masked], encouraging membership, participation, and leadership among emerging professionals. Under her leadership the FutureNOW Summit was launched in 2012, a day-long conference, where participants investigated the evolving roles of marketing, branding, social technologies, diverse business models, and civic leadership within the architectural industry. Brynnemarie continues to engage her peers and senior practitioners by developing a mentorship program for the AIA New York Chapter. Brynnemarie received a Bachelor of Architecture from Roger Williams University in 2005, and became a registered Architect for New York State in 2012.  

Ruben Cano is an Owner and Managing Partner of 52XConsulting, a search firm and management consultant dedicated to serving architecture, interiors and design  related businesses.  Understanding that a design firm is only as good as the people they employ, 52X works to recognize the unique talents that all design professionals possess - and how to leverage those assets towards specific individual career goals, without losing sight of the risk vs. reward inherent in every employment opportunity and creative endeavor. With 13 years of experience in the field and an education in both Fine Art and Psychology - Ruben's unique perspective has allowed him access to business leaders in the design world ranging from boutique design firms of international renown to corporate architectural practices, developers, retailers/brands, fortune 500 and various other businesses that rely on, provide, and ultimately monetize design services. 

Moderator: 

Melissa Marsh is Founder and CEO of PLASTARC, a social research, workplace innovation, and real estate strategy firm dedicated to shifting the metrics associated with workplace from 'square feet and inches', to 'occupant satisfaction and performance.' PLASTARC, a portmanteau of plastic and architecture, encourages architecture to be more flexible, dynamic, and fun through social research and analytics. PLASTARC employs people analytics, building information systems, and a variety of creative methods in order to enable environments and real estate strategies that enhance organizational knowledge, accelerate business and enrich employees. @PLASTARC
results.name: FutureNOW: The Talent Gap

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT - BOOK YOUR SEAT HERE!</a>

Do I have a great (UBER like) business idea, and will it make money?  What happens if it fails, or worse, what happens if it's a success!  Where do I start...I don't have the funds or experience?

Do these questions sound familiar and are holding you back from starting your business?

As a serial entrepreneur and corporate exec I totally get the fear, apprehension, and self doubt that plagues you in taking that plunge and starting your business.  In this three hour interactive workshop you will learn:

•  The 3 key steps to turn your idea into reality

•  How to leverage low cost highly effective sales & marketing tactics

•  The people, resources & tools you need to be successful

This is an interactive workshop, and we encourage you to tweet any questions before and during the workshop by using @MarisaWarren16 #StartupSuccess

<a href="https://yourstartupsuccess.leadpages.co/september-2015-nyc-workshop-pricing/">THIS IS A PAID EVENT - BOOK YOUR SEAT HERE!

"If it weren't for Marisa’s advice, positive reassurance and lateral thinking I wouldn't have built a successful recruitment company." 

Kristine Evans | Owner @ Two Creek Kids

SPEAKERS


Marisa Warren | Speaker | Founder @ CAVALO Consulting | Chairwoman & Founding Director @ ELEVACAO Foundation

Marisa is a highly awarded serial entrepreneur, global corporate executive and philanthropist - working across the America's, Asia, Australia and Europe.  Over the last 18 years Marisa has built 3 tech-focused companies from concept to revenue generating in under 2 months, is an accredited CompTIA speaker, and worked for companies such as Workday, SAP, and Microsoft.

In 2011 New York was calling, with suitcase in hand Marisa made the courageous move.  Marisa didn't know a soul, have a job or apartment, but that didn't stop her.  Since that fateful move Marisa built her consulting business from scratch securing SAP, Microsoft partners and Telstra Global as customers.

In 2014 Marisa co-founded ELEVACAO Foundation, where our mission is to Empower 1,000 Women Entrepreneurs by 2018 to build and launch successful tech businesses.

SPECIAL GUEST SPEAKER!

Jen Glantz | Speaker | Writer | Founder & CEO Bridesmaid for Hire

Jen is the founder and CEO of Bridesmaid for Hire, providing in-person and digital support for brides to help plan and orchestrate their special day - whether virtually, before their wedding, or up at the altar.

Since launching in 2014, Jen has been featured for 54+ straight weeks, by over 500 major media outlets around the world.  Programs and publications such as Good Morning America, TODAY Show, CNN Money, Huffington Post and BRIDES Magazine, have all showcased Jen’s expert opinion for all things bridesmaid related.


Jen is a featured keynote speaker at some of the top startup, entrepreneur and wedding conferences. On top of all that…Jen is also the author of an Amazon best-seller ‘All My Friends are Engaged.'

WHAT OTHERS ARE SAYING

"Marisa's experience and knowledge of the IT industry was immediately apparent and delivered great value for our audience. Marisa is a highly valuable resource and engaging presenter. I have no hesitation in recommending her as a speaker."

Stacy Conrad | Vice President Channel Sales @ Fusion Telecommunications

"Marisa’s presentation and facilitation style ensured that she kept our diverse team of leaders from Europe, Asia, Australia and the US focused and engaged throughout the workshop."

Adrian Martin | Head of Wholesale Sales, America's & EMEA @ Telstra Global

results.description:
The Happiness is a Habit workshop combines the science of happiness (positive psychology) and what we know about health and fitness with the undeniable power of habits to create an easy to implement method for building confidence, while improving daily life and raising happiness levels at the same time.  


Renovate the rhythm of your life to create a healthier, happier you! Forget superficial fixes like fad diets or shopping sprees and instead learn how implementing simple daily habits can improve your quality of life. Author Michele Phillips will guide you in your quest to happiness by introducing you to helpful routines like:

Listening to audio books in the shower
Spending time with nature
Establishing a bad day emergency plan
Practicing realistic optimism
Finding your spiritual center 

As Michele takes you through her practical guide to happiness, you will come to see that the confidence, vitality, and joy that you deserve are just a habit away!

This workshop is appropriate for anyone who is looking to take responsibility to connect with themselves and create happiness on a regular basis.

YOU MUST REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT AHEAD OF TIME HERE:http://keyperformance.ticketleap.com/happiness-is-a-habit-public-workshop/


Michele Phillips is the president of Key Performance and the author of Happiness is a Habit – Simple Daily Rituals That Increase Energy,Improve Well-Being and Add Joy to Every Day (Cedar FortPublishing 2013). Michele’s professional experience spans over 20years facilitating engaging workshops, seminars and coachingprograms with Fortune 500 companies around the globe including:TAG Heuer, Pfizer Pharmaceuticals, Barclay’s Capital, Verizon Wireless and COACH leather, just to name a few.
results.name: Happiness is a Habit Public Workshop with Author Michele Phillips

iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!

https://www.cvent.com/d/vrqgpr?lang=en&sms=7&cn=xTpCau8jDECwObrB5sQ10g

(T)ERROR : A Social Cinema Screening with the Brennan Center for Justice

Wednesday, September 30, 2015

06:30 PM – 08:30 PM

156 Fifth Avenue, Second Floor

New York, NY 10010

RSVP 

Map it

A real-life thriller, (T)ERROR is the first documentary to place filmmakers on the ground during a live FBI counterterrorism sting operation of a suspected jihadist. With unprecedented access to an active informant – Saeed "Shariff" Torres, a 63 year old former Black Panther – viewers get an unfettered glimpse of the government's counterterrorism tactics and the murky justifications behind them. (T)ERROR illuminates the fragile relationships between individual and surveillance state in modern America, and asks – who is watching the watchers?

Join New America NYC and the Brennan Center for Justice for a screening of (T)ERROR and a conversation with the film's director and leading surveillance and counterterrorism experts on just how far we're willing to go to prevent terror – and the liberties we're sacrificing to get there.

PARTICIPANTS
Introduction:Beth DembitzerCurator, Social Cinema@New America
@bethdembitzer

Participants:David Felix Sutcliffe
Co-director, (T)ERROR
@davidfsutcliffe

Diala ShamasSenior Staff Attorney, CLEAR project, CUNY School of Law
@CUNY_CLEAR

Mike GermanFellow, Liberty and National Security Program, Brennan Center for Justice

RSVP

Talk-About Moderator - Stephen
results.name: Talk-About "(T)ERROR"­­ Free Documentary screening & Panel Discussion

This is 1 hour English class, followed by a 1 hour English / Spanish Conversation Exchange.  While you are in your English class, there is a group of native English speakers taking a Spanish class.  After the classes finish, the two groups meet up for an English / Spanish Conversation Exchange.  This gives you the chance to practice everything that you just learned in the class before with a native English speaker.

Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. MINY Toastmasters is proud to be one of the 14,650 clubs in 126 countries that make up Toastmasters International Global network of meeting locations.

MINY Toastmasters provide a supportive and positive learning experience in which members are empowered to develop their communication and leadership skills, resulting in greater self-confidence and personal growth. By regularly giving speeches, gaining feedback, leading teams and guiding others to achieve their goals in a supportive atmosphere, leaders emerge from the Toastmasters program. Our goal at MINY Toastmasters is to empower individuals to become more effective communicators and leaders.

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: New & Existing Member Social Networking & Welcome Party--Free Event

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and <a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com">www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
- - - THE FILM - - -

Nightmare Code is an innovative sci-fi thriller about behavior recognition technology, behavior modification, 24/7 surveillance and artificial intelligence. It stars Andrew J. West (The Walking Dead, Under The Dome) and Mei Melançon (X-Men: The Last Stand, The L-Word).  Imagine The Shining in a tech startup as told by H.A.L. From 2001: A Space Odyssey.


It was the winner of The 2015 Philip K. Dick Science Fiction Film Festival, and "Best Thriller" at The 14th Annual Shriekfest Horror and SciFi Film Festival. 

Filmmaker, Mark Netter, will be showing his award-winning feature film and doing a Q&A directly to follow.


This screening celebrates the release of NIGHTMARE CODE on iTunes and other digital platforms.  It’s a unique chance to see the groundbreaking visuals in a setting similar to that of the movie, and to find out how Director/Co-Writer/Producer Netter was able to complete this film, with over 600 visual effects, for a budget of $200,000.  

PLEASE NOTE: Contains several scenes of shocking violence and brief partial nudity.

- - - THE SCHEDULE - - -

6:00pm - 6:30pm : Drinks, Food, & Networking *$2 covers the cost of pizza and (lots of) beer & wine!

6:30pm - 8:00pm : Film Screening

8:00pm - : Q&A with Mark Netter (+ more drinks & networking)

- - - THE TRAILER - - -

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XlOpU6w2SyQ

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.

results.description:
Only $175 for the entire 13 week semester! Please email or message el centro to confirm we are still accepting students before coming to this class. 

In the Level 3 Spanish class students will already have a working knowledge, but more advanced capacity, in the basics of conversation. At this level students will be expected to have gained the ability to read and write simple sentences. The main objectives of Level 3 will be to improve fluidity, improve vocabulary and improve overall understanding of spoken and written Spanish. After one term in level 3 students will be prepared for basic and brief conversations. After two terms in level 3 students will have finished with the a more advanced conversational ability in anticipation of the level 4 environment. 

En la clase de Nivel 3 de español, alumnos ya tendrán un conocimiento práctico pero mas avanzado en cuanto los conceptos básicos de conversación.  En éste nivel se esperará que los estudiantes han obtenido la capacidad de leer y escribir oraciones simples.  Los principales objetivos del nivel 3 serán mejorar la fluidez de los estudiantes, mejorar el vocabulario y mejorar la comprensión general del español hablado y escrito.  Después de un semestre en el nivel 3 los estudiantes estarán preparados para conversaciones básicas y breves.  Después de dos semestres en el nivel 3 los alumnos terminaran con la capacidad para conversaciones y comunicaciones escritas mas avanzadas en anticipación al ambiente del nivel 4.

results.description:
Lecture followed by reception

Dr. Pier Gabriele Mancuso, Director of the Eugene Grant Research Program on Jewish History and Culture in Early Modern Europe of the Medici Archive Research Project of Florence, Italy.

Dr. Mancuso discusses the historical and sociological background of the world's first ghetto, constructed in Venice in 1516, how this new physical segregation was traversed by numerous exchanges and cross-religious interactions, and compelling musical developments within both Jewish and Catholic sacred repertoire that developed from the fascination of one religious culture with the Other.


On 29th March 1516 the Senate of the Most Serene Republic of Venice established the first Jewish ghetto in the world. Ashkenazi and Italian Jews were forced to live in a relatively big island – that of the geto, in Venetian vernacular meaning “foundry” – surrounded by canals, supervised at night by Christian police, and to undergo a series of socio-economic restrictions aiming to mark a clear distinction between the Jews and the Christian-Catholic majority. 

A few decades later also Jews from Spain and the Levant were forced to enter the ghetto. Made up by Jews speaking different languages, observing different religious rules and customs, dressing and behaving differently, listening to different music repertoires, the ghetto soon became a colorful microcosm, a pre-modern socio-cultural melting pot. In spite of the official anti-Jewish legislation, in Venice, Florence, and Rome and in many other Italian and European cities hosting a ghetto, Judeo-Christian human, cultural, intellectual and nonetheless artistic interactions were inevitable. 

Music probably much more than any other form of artistic discipline expressed the permeability of the ghetto’s walls, the repertoire of one community becoming – often involuntarily, unconsciously – patrimony of the other one, traditional monodic Jewish tunes resounding in the polyphonic fabrics of ecclesiastical cappella music, secular Gentile tunes (often those of very obscene popular songs) accompanying some of the most sacred moments during the Hebrew liturgy. This lecture explores Judeo-Christian music interactions during the early modern era, with attention to the rabbinical and ecclesiastical views on this cultural cross-polination, with a look at original contemporary Jewish and Christian sources.
results.name: Lecture on 16th century Venice: Cracks in the Wall

results.description:
I am very excited to announce LaunchNJ: Ed Tech groups inaugural event. We have a lot of really great people who have been working behind the scene's to make this a kick ass group... and it is.

Our first event is being done in conjunction LaunchNJ's founding meetup but I am confident that the team running this group will do an amazing job providing events that cater to Ed Tech entrepreneurs.

A LaunchNJ Entrepreneurial Deep Dive is when we get a talented entrepreneur and have them share their knowledge in a very interactive manner. There are (3) 15 minute presentations with each one being followed by 15 minutes of group discussions.

Bio

Entrepreneur, scholar and music industry veteran, Abran Maldonado is the CEO and Founder of NuSkool. He has spent over a decade addressing the needs of underserved youth using a hybrid approach fusing both entertainment and education through professional development, student enrichment and educational research. After several years in the entertainment industry, Abran decided to further explore digital media and other aspects of youth culture and their implications on the advancement of 21st century education. Abran was honored by the Gates Foundation as a Gates Millennium Scholar, an award given to future leaders in the community. He has made the most of the opportunity and has since received a BS in Communication Arts from St. John’s University, an MA in Interdisciplinary Studies in Education from Teachers College and is currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Teaching and Learning at NYU where he is working with Pedro Noguera, Ph.D. on developing new research in the field of Urban Education. Twitter: @EdTechAbe

Presentation

Abran will take us on a three part journey that includes the trials and tribulations of founding a startup, the pros and cons of participating in accelerator programs and how to make NJ the next great edtech ecosystem. Abran is never one to shy away from telling it like it is, join us for this candid talk with one of NJ's hardest working entrepreneurs.

Agenda:

6:30 to 7:00   Pizza & Networking

7:00 to 7:15   Updates

7:15 to 7:30   Needs and asks

7:30 to 8:00  The trials and tribulations of founding a startup

8:00 to 8:30   Pros and cons of participating in accelerator programs

8:30 to 9:00   NJ the next great Edtech ecosystem
results.how_to_find_us: Drew University
results.name: Entrepreneurial Deep Dive

results.description:
Our last Bowling Meetup sold out! This could be our last one of the year so don't miss it!! 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1JmdHgK

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1NXEZgU

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins.  A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

What's included:

• Free Bowling Games, Shoe Rental & Scorecard Matching 

• Ice Breakers

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1JmdHgK

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1NXEZgU

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door


Can I still attend even If I don't want to bowl?  Yes, you can still be a member of the team and mingle.  Food & Drink will also be available for purchase.


Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own.


Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages 20s-40s.

How do I attend?  RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5903

results.description:
Our last Bowling Meetup sold out! This could be our last one of the year so don't miss it!! 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1JmdHgK

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1NXEZgU

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins.  A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

What's included:

• Free Bowling Games, Shoe Rental & Scorecard Matching 

• Ice Breakers

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1JmdHgK

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1NXEZgU

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door 

Can I still attend even If I don't want to bowl?  Yes, you can still be a member of the team and mingle.  Food & Drink will also be available for purchase. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages 20s-40s.

How do I attend?  RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5903
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

Join us at one of the coolest lounges in NYC for an evening of networking and drinks with many of the best Entrepreneurs NYC has to offer!

Atmosphere: 
- The dress code is Business Casual. 
- We will provide name tags for everyone that attends. We ask that you put your name and industry on your name tag. 
- Make sure you bring enough business cards.

Time is Precious: 
- Event is from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time so everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like.

Admission: 
- FREE for the First 1100 RSVP on Meetup 
- $20 for everyone else

Drinks: 
- 2 drink norm, 1 drink min. Because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event, all our networking events require a "2 drink norm, 1 drink minimum!"

***Since this is a drinking establishment, all attendees must be 21+.***

*************************** 


Event Sponsor:

For those who want extra exposure at our events you can do so by becoming a sponsor.  As a courtesy we only accept one sponsor in each industry. 

Benefits of becoming a sponsor are: your company name, link to your website, and a short company description will be include in the event page and our emails.  CLICK HERE TO RESERVE YOUR SPONSOR SPOT NOW!

results.description:
>>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here. 


POZ MAGAZINE FOUNDER AND ‘BODY COUNTS’ AUTHOR SEAN STRUB IN CONVERSATION WITH JOURNALIST AND ACTIVIST ANN NORTHROP.

On Wednesday, September 30, at Manhattan’s handsomely renovated LGBT Center, Out Professionals presents author Sean Strub (“Body Counts: A Memoir of Activism, Sex, and Survival”) in conversation with veteran journalist and activist Ann Northrop.

As the vivid portrait of a tumultuous era, “Body Counts” crackles with history. “From the Senate elevator to Studio 54 to Andy Warhol and Tennessee Williams, Gore Vidal and John Lennon … to the famous demonstration inside St. Patrick’s Cathedral … this is the compelling life-and-near-death story of Sean Strub, of thousands lost to HIV/AIDS and thousands more living with it whom his activism helped save“ — Andrew Tobias (“The Best Little Boy in the World”).

In “Body Counts,” Sean takes readers inside ACT UP, the activist organization that transformed a stigmatized cause into one of the defining political movements of our time. He identifies the heroes and villains of the early years of AIDS, recounting the bravery and the cowardice of politicians, doctors and everyday people.

Lily Tomlin terms Sean’s memoir “Powerful.” Choreographer and director Bill T. Jones calls it “Fresh and compelling.” Gloria Steinem writes, “By taking us with him on his journey from a conservative family in Iowa to the heart of a global movement for human rights, Sean Strub gives us ideas, strength and heart in our own journey.”

Sean Strub, the first openly HIV-positive candidate for the US Congress, produced David Drake’s hit play, “The Night Larry Kramer Kissed Me.” Founder of POZ magazine, Sean has been engaged in HIV-related stigma, discrimination, criminalization and empowerment issues since the earliest days of the epidemic. He now serves as executive director of the Sero Project.

Ann Northrop, a veteran AIDS educator and AIDS activist, co-hosts the weekly national cable show “Gay USA” with Andy Humm. Earlier Ann served as a writer-producer for ABC’s “Good Morning America” and as coordinating producer of CBS Morning News. As a member of ACT UP/NY, she participated in hundreds of demonstrations and was arrested “a couple of dozen” times. Ann and Sean have been friends and colleagues since those days. She is featured in the books “Making History,” by Eric Marcus; “Wolf Girls at Vassar,” by Anne Mackay; and “Queer in America,” by Michelangelo Signorile.

Northrop photo: Dixie Sheridan.

WHERE

The LGBT Community Center, 208 West 13th Street, between 7th and 8th Avenues. Subway: 1/2/3, A/C/E or F/M to 14th Street; L to 6th or 8th Avenue. Directions from where you are: hopstop.com

WHAT’S UP

Doors open at 6:30 p.m. for advance seating and book sales; complimentary wines and waters. Program and Q&A, 7:15 p.m. Book signing, 8:00 p.m.

2-4-1 ADMISSION

Nonmember, $20 for two. Dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, $10 for two. Complimentary wines and waters. To help us plan, order here now. Please print and pocket a copy of your online receipt. Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

SPECIAL MEMBERSHIP OFFER

Twelve-month individual OP membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission to tonight’s prestigious event, just $65 total. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Hear About the Era of Act Up, Activism, and AIDS

results.description:
The best way to learn is to teach! 

At this meetup, you will break into groups and pick a technical challenge or concept to explain to your fellow meetup group members in a short presentation. We'll give each group some themes to get started as well as time to create the presentation. 

It will be a great way to practice your speaking skills and organize your thoughts around a technical concern. You will also get to network with fellow female developers and learn from the best and the brightest in NYC! 


We also have Amanda Kievet giving a lightning talk, Zen and the Art of Progressive Enhancement:

"Use progressive enhancement to craft accessible, well-structured, and device agnostic code. As a junior developer, I found the world of endless JS frameworks intimidating and chaotic, with battles being waged between evangelists on Twitter. Using progressive enhancement creates a more Zen experience by keeping your codebase simpler and easier to reason about. In a world where new frameworks, libraries, and architecture styles are going in and out of fashion with the seasons, everyone could use a little more Zen."

------------------------------------------------

Bring your laptop, bring your friends, and leave with an increased understanding of multiple tech topics. 

As always, there will be vegan and gluten-free-friendly food and beverages, as well as time for socializing, from 6:30-7pm.


Please note: this is an event intended for software developers who identify as women. We define "software developer" as anyone who has written a line of code (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Ruby, Python, Java, whatever) and can explain what it does. Write/Speak/Code is for women, cis and trans, and is emphatically trans and queer friendly.
results.name: Learn & Teach Tech with Write/Speak/Code

results.description:
Hey! This month we will be chatting with Adam Goldman. Adam has over 20 years of experience in marketing and sales. He has held almost every position imaginable in both verticals and has bought or sold every type of media across all platforms. Most notably, he was the VP of Digital Sales and Strategy for CBS Interactive Music Group, Director of Marketing at USA, and is currently CMO at Makeable, a digital innovation agency. He will be talking about maintaining meaningful interactions with customers and business partners in a digital world.

We'll get a chance to hear his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Mostly, we want people to get to know each other and see how we can all build a great community together. Some box wine and snacks will be provided. The learning segment of the meetup will only be around 45 minutes long to allow people to mingle.

See you soon!

Thank you to our sponsors:

Startup Institute was created and designed by Techstars, and is a community and mentorship-driven accelerator that helps new entrepreneurs join high-growth companies. With offices in NYC, Chicago, London and Berlin, there are more than 1000 alumni worldwide already with more graduating all the time. The Startup Institute is building “Neighborhoods” of entrepreneurial and diverse tech communities around the world.


LiquidTalent enables professional connection and financial transaction in real-time, based on location. The company presents users with income-earning opportunities based on skills, experience and geographic location. LiquidTalent's vision is to create an independent lifestyle marketplace where talented working professionals with spare capacity can build their careers.

WeWork empowers entrepreneurs and small businesses to succeed by providing beautiful workspace, a collaborative community, and accessible services and benefits.

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description:
Join us at The Ainsworth Midtown (previously the Chester Midtown) for a night of networking, drinks, and tech demos from a few of the best tech startups NYC has to offer! Mix and mingle with Founders, CTO’s, Product Managers among other tech professionals from a few of New York City's HOTTEST startups. Enjoy cocktails and networking with other NYC techies while viewing live demos of each company’s product. Have a question about one of our featured companies? Feel free to pick their brains about their product, technologies used, how they got started, and much more!

Demo Companies:

beGlammed

beGlammed is the leading on-demand beauty app that sends industry professional hair stylists and makeup artists directly to our clients' doors.  We glam our clients from the comfort of their homes, offices, hotels, or while they're on the road traveling.  We currently offer hair and makeup services in Los Angeles, Orange County, San Diego, Las Vegas, Austin, Dallas/Ft. Worth, Houston, Miami, and New York City (with even more cities in the works).  Each stylist is personally hand-selected by our founder, who has over a decade of experience in the beauty industry, to ensure we only hire the very best of the best.  Appointments can be easily booked via our app, website, or by calling us directly.

GoButler

Founded in February 2015, GoButler is a 100% free, text-based, on-demand virtual personal assistant that uses a legion of over 120 trained operators, known as 'heroes,' to fulfill users' requests for products and services 24/7, making everyday life more convenient & efficient. GoButler leverages the best companies and brands, arranging user requests from meal and grocery delivery to travel arrangements, restaurant reservations and everything in between. Looking to book a romantic reservation for two in Paris overlooking the Eiffel Tower? Get a hangover cure delivered to your hotel room in Las Vegas? Deliver a bouquet of flowers to your sweetheart? A birthday cake for your best friend from Momofuku's Milk Bar? GoButler has you covered.

FlyCleaners

FlyCleaners is designing the easiest, most convenient dry cleaning & laundry experience imaginable. You tap your phone, and someone is at your door on-demand, usually in 15-30 mins, to pick up your dry cleaning and laundry. Laundry is done overnight (if it's picked up at 10pm, it's ready at 7:30am the next morning), and a running 6am to midnight, 7 days/week. All for just about the same price as the place on the corner.

Zeel

Zeel delivers Massage On Demand® – top-quality massages from licensed, vetted massage therapists to homes, hotels, workplaces, and events in as little as an hour, or up to a month in advance. With Zeel, customers enjoy a massage in the comfort, convenience, safety, and privacy of the place and time of their choosing, 7 days a week, 365 days a year, with start times as early as 8 am and as late as 10:30 pm. Booking, scheduling, and payment are made easy with the Zeel app for iPhone and Android. Zeel Massage On Demand is available in the NYC Tri-State Area, South Florida, the San Francisco Bay Area, Southern California, and Chicago. 


ZIRX

ZIRX is the leading on-demand valet and car services company. Through the ZIRX mobile app, consumers can now easily indicate their location and within minutes have a ZIRX Agent arrive and valet park their car in a secure lot. While parked, consumers can easily opt for a gas fill-up, a car wash and more via the ZIRX app. When ready to leave, the car can be delivered to a requested location, at the tap of a button.

**Use Promo Code "TECHINMOTION" for 1 free day of parking (equal to $25)  in Manhattan.

--


As always we would like to thank our sponsors Workbridge Associates</a>, <a href="http://www.jobspringpartners.com/locations/new-york">Jobspring Partners, SparkPost & QS World MBA Tour for sponsoring this month’s event.

--

Learn more about our sponsors:

SparkPost: is the cloud solution from Message Systems, the world’s number one email infrastructure provider, whose customers—including Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Groupon, Salesforce, Marketo, Pinterest, Zillow and Comcast—send over 3 trillion messages a year, over 25% of the world’s legitimate email. Our software outperforms every other cloud or on-premises alternative, and these companies choose us to provide the deliverability, speed and insight they need to drive customer engagement for their business. Follow us on Twitter @SparkPost or go to sparkpost.com.


The QS World MBA Tour: will be making a stop at the Hilton New York on September 20th from 12:30pm-6:00pm. 

This event is your opportunity to meet with admissions directors from the top local and international business schools, and network with top tier alumni who will share their study and career success stories. As an attendee, you will be eligible to apply for exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M and attend panels and seminars to have all of your MBA questions answered in one place.

Their goal is to provide ambitious professionals like you with the best tools in order to facilitate your personal and professional development. We ensure that you have access to top business schools and education experts to help make this very important decision.

Entry is free for members of Tech in Motion New York, but places are limited so make sure you register today.


--

results.description:
How soon should the marketing "team" get involved in the product development cycle? 

From project plans to product launch, marketing your product is not the same as corporate marketing.

Join us on Wednesday, September 30, from 6:30pm - 8:30pm, to find out why it's important to involve marketing early in your product development cycle, and how your company can benefit from giving marketing a seat at the table from the very beginning!

Panelists:

Ilan Nass - Director of Marketing, Fueled/Founder, Taktical

Michael Rotella- VP, Internet and Mobile, Digital Usage and Engagement, Citi

Folake Oguntebi - Founder, GoodHair

Moderator:

Shari Hazlett:
Organizer, Empire Startups & Marketing Meetup
Marketing Services Delivery Manager, Bluewolf

Partner: TekServe & TekServe Studio

results.description:
Join us for some priority queue and hashing algorithms at Handy HQ. On Wednesday, we will be going over the problems in the first half of the fourth chapter of The Algorithm Design Manual by Steven S Skiena.

I have several copies of the text and it is available online. There will also be food and drink provided by Handy.

We will be covering sections 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9 and 4.10.

Please read Chapter 4 prior to the meet up and be prepared to solve the problems from the end of the chapter.
results.name: Algorithm Club: Chapter 4 “Sorting and Searching" (4.6-4.10)

results.description:
Dreams Do Come True!
More and more, people are choosing to be their own boss. With the rise of freelancer sites, the allure of starting a startup, and the internet of course, technology has paved the way for the rising numbers of people worldwide making the choice to work for themselves.

SuperTasker and PeoplePerHour and excited to host this panel where we'll discuss all the factors that are contributing to this growing phenomenon and what the future of work holds.

Our Panelists:

Megan Hannum, Partner at FundedBuy
Dan Weldon, Sr. Director of Sales at Vitamin T
Cynthia Hellen, Founder & CEO at SMPLCT Lab
Bruce Bergman, Economist at Bureau of Labor Statistics
results.name: The Future of Work: The rise of the Self-Employed

results.description:
Please note that this event is a part of Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of people registered on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending from all the groups.  If you have any questions regarding how many or about the event itself contact Dave at [masked]

Our tours are designed for people who live work and play  in NYC, not tourists.  They are meant to open your eyes to the things that you may walk past everyday and never realize what you are passing by! If you are a native New Yorker or new to the city there is so much we take for granted, so much history, hidden secrets and fun facts that await you when you join us and explore and socialize with other fun people from NYSN and the other social groups participating!

The group will meet at Brother Jimmy's  near Penn Station then go through Herald Square, The edge of Times Square, Bryant Park and end at Grand Central.  From there you have the option to join us for our weekly Happy Hour at Lexington's a few blocks away. You will be amazed at the amount of history and hidden things you will see along the way.  Your tour guide will show you pictures from the late 18 and early 1900’s plus share the historical significances of each location.  The tour lasts about 90 minutes.

What to wear: Dress casual/business casual. Wear comfortable shoes

What to Bring: maybe a bottle of water for the walk and your sense of adventure!

What to Expect: 15-25 fun and friendly people who are looking to make new friends and learn a little about the city

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change $15

What is included?  The tour fee

What if it rains? We will send an email update by 2pm the day of the tour

Meet at Brother Jimmy's BBQ on the corner of 8th ave and 31st across from Madison Square Garden from 6-6:30pm for a cocktail.  The tour leaves at 6:30pm

If there are not many registered from this group remember that there will be several people coming from The New York Social Network and other Meet Up groups.
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorker's Midtown 34th -42nd Plus After Tour Party

group.name: 365+ Cool Things To Do With Fun People In New York

results.description:
A healthy mind and body is key to a successful, joyful and happy life. Learning to manage the mind, emotions, stress in today's world is a much needed life skill. Did you know our very own breath actually holds a secret to a healthy and happy existence? :) Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes! In this one hour workshop we will explore the connection between the breath, mind and body and learn a few breathing techniques to relax and rejuvenate. We will top it off with a guided meditation - no experience necessary :)

The workshop is also an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program that has benefited over 40 million people worldwide . Don't hesitate to ask for the upcoming program.

So come join us!
results.name: Happiness Inside Out

group.name: "Art of Living" NYC- Making Life a Celebration

This event is hosted by New-York-Entrepreneurs-and-Startup-Network, biggest network in NY.
Over 350 people attend.

Join us at one of the coolest lounges in NYC for a night of networking and drinks with many of the best Entrepreneurs NYC has to offer!

Atmosphere: 
- The dress code is Business Casual. 
- We will provide name tags for everyone that attends. We ask that you put your name and industry on your name tag. 
- Make sure you bring enough business cards.

Time is Precious: 
- Event is from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time so everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like.

Admission:

- $20 for everyone else

Drinks: 
- 2 drink norm, 1 drink min. Because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event, all our networking events require a "2 drink norm, 1 drink minimum!"

***Since this is a drinking establishment, all attendees must be 21+.***

results.description:
Lean practitioners often prioritize learning over growth during the early stages of an idea. But what happens when the growth arrives before the team expects it? Before they know much about their products and customers? That’s what happened when Nicole (a Senior Product Manager at Neo) partnered with one developer to run a small experiment, that became more than they expected.


Nicole will talk about how a team of two created a service that instantly (and unexpectedly) went viral. She’ll talk about how they quickly adjusted by expanding the team and rapidly iterated the product to serve the needs of the growing user-base. Nicole will also talk about what the team did to stay disciplined, accountable and committed to learning during a period of rapid growth. She’ll also explore important themes she’s learned about people-powered products: What happens when people (instead of technology) hold the primary value in your stack?

Bio


Nicole Rufuku has spent the majority of her career in product strategy, where she’s developed an expertise in consumer marketplaces, customer development, and business model design. She’s currently working at the NYC office of Neo, as a Senior Product Manager where she leads small teams of developers and designers on client projects.

Before Neo, Nicole was a co-founder at Lightmatter, managed Strategy at Seamless and founded two marketplace startups in real-estate and fitness.
results.name: Learning Through Growth: The Ask Alexis Experiment
