results.description:
Welcome Back from our wonderful summer!

It is time, once again, to come back together with like-minded people and help us to continue our discussions on how to take control of our lives with the most positive uplifting teaching around the Law of Attraction and other Spiritual laws.

This month our topic is all around

Ending all of our Victimhood once and for all!

Do you know how powerful your energy is?

Do you see how our responses creates the reality around us?

Are you ready to understand how to change our vibrational co-dependency?

Then come on out for our next Apply the Law of Attraction meeting as we delve deep into why negative people are still coming out of the woodwork even though you are changing your vibration and focusing on all the positive aspects of your life?

We'll talk all about how everything is here to help and serve you, and how our own love is really here to transform us, regardless of whether you see any changes in anyone else.

In preparation for this co-creative experience, please watch the following video on this topic from Matt Kahn:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=agGBT2tsJGg


Learn how when someone is acting negative to you, that it is not about you at all, but about how they were mistreated themselves. The negative comments they make are not aimed at us, but the angel that lives inside of all of us. We are here to break the cycle of abuse and raise our own vibration by the way we show our love for others, without any expectation of their change. Through our own authentic confidence in our ability to love, we raise our vibration and their showing up negatively is our opportunity to grow. 

This event is by donation only, so everyone is welcome so please bring your friends! Our recommended donation is $15, but please do not let that keep you away, after all, you are a masterful creator are you not?

Please come out and tell your friends and let's make this a truly wonderful experience!

We look forward to seeing you on Wednesday evening the 30th, from 6:30pm - 8:30pm at 151 West 25th Street, 4th Floor.

Joyfully,

Sam
results.name: Ending Victimhood with LOA

group.name: Applying the Law of Attraction for Results!

results.description:
Join the NJ Tech Meetup in collaboration with Newark Ventures Partner for this very special evening of discussion and networking.  Limited seats available.  Detailed directions here.

Agenda:

• 6:00 Door Opens / Drinks and Networking (arrive by 6:30!) 

• 6:30 - 7:00 Welcome and hear from Newark Venture Partners with a discussion between Dimitris Kouvaros (VC, NVP) and Tom Wisniewski (Managing Partner, NVP, learn more here)

• 7:00 - 8:00 Light Dinner & Fireside Chat With Don Katz, founder (Audible.com)

• 8:00 - 9:00 Networking, Drinks

Expect to meet interesting people, learn something useful and have a shot at our raffle to win some great prizes.


Location:  


Audible / NVP Headquarters

1 Washington Place 15th Fl

Newark, NJ

Here are detailed directions via train or car.

Can't be there?  Follow @NJTech and look for the livestreaming link when we go live.   


WATCH THE LIVESTREAM:

http://meerkatapp.co/njtech

---------------------------------------

About Don Katz: 

Donald Katz is founder and CEO of Audible, Inc., the leading provider of premium digital  spoken audio information and entertainment on the Internet. Prior to founding Audible,  Katz was a journalist and author for twenty years; his work won a National Magazine  Award, an Overseas Press Club Award, the Chicago Tribune Heartland Prize for Nonfiction, and was nominated for a National Book Critics Circle Award, among other prizes.  Learn more about Don....


------------------

About Newark Venture Partners:

Newark Venture Partners will manage an early-stage investment fund that will provide capital as well as sophisticated company-building services and a collaborative state-of-the-art 25,000-square-foot accelerator workspace with gigabit-plus fiber to the desktop, lightning-fast Wi-Fi, and ultra-high bandwidth access to the Internet for innovative tech start-ups in Newark. The accelerator’s One Washington Park location, adjacent to Newark’s Broad Street train station and just eighteen minutes by train from Manhattan, also houses the headquarters of Audible and its Newark-based employees as well as the Rutgers University Business School, which is providing rent-free access to the facility, now being readied for construction in the building.  Learn more about NVP...
results.how_to_find_us: 15th Floor
results.name: NJ Tech Meetup & Newark Venture Partners Host Dinner & Don Katz (CEO Audible)

A poultry box for $150. The poultry box has 1 goose, 2 ducks, 1 young rooster and 2 guinea hens.

THE FARMER'S WILL NOT BE PROVIDING AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX IN ADVANCE.  THEY HAVE AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX POSTED TO EACH BOX ON DELIVERY DAY.

THE FARMERS WILL NOT BE DELIVERING TO INDIVIDUAL ADDRESSES MIX BOXES ALONE.  PLEASE COME AND PICK UP YOUR MIX BOX.  EXCEPTION - 2 OR MORE PEOPLE GETTING TWO SHIPMENTS WOULD LIKE TO HAVE IT DELIVERED TO THE SAME PLACE - THEY WILL DELIVER FOR THAT.

Prepayment is required athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5903

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

 $30-$35 depending on how early you register.

results.description:
After learning the machine basics and making a tote, let's continue with some new fresh projects. Leggings may seem a bit daunting, but with the right guidance, pattern and techniques they are actually pretty easy.

What we learn:
Go over how to use the machine
How to sew with stretch fabric
How to use stretch stitches
How to finish a garment
Hem a pair of pants
Sew an elastic waistband
Use a pattern for sewing Garments
Take measurements

What we need:
1.25 Yards of fun Spandex fabric- you can find this at Spandex House, Spandex World or any of those Spandex stores on 38th St (NYC) between 7th and 8th Ave.
I will provide the patterns, and elastic for waistband. Feel free to invite other creative and nice friends to the group and classes.
Please RSVP and let me know you are coming- so I can send the address and phone number to let you in.

$60/class- you must buy fabric, i will provide elastic.

results.description:
Join Customer Success - NYC on Wednesday, September 30th for a meetup with Cassie Lancellotti-Young, EVP of Customer Success at Sailthru. She will be sharing with us her experiences and expertise building and running a global Customer Success team.


About Cassie and Sailthru:

Cassie is EVP of Customer Success at Sailthru, where she oversees customer strategy and operations globally, a 52-person team spread across four offices worldwide. Their CS team includes implementation, technical support, account management and strategy/analytics.

Cassie graduated from Duke University and holds an MBA from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth. Her work around marketing analytics has been featured by publications such as NYTimes, Mashable, VentureBeat, Inc. Magazine, Women's Wear Daily and WIRED. 


Saithru is a marketing technology company that builds email and personalization software for fast-growing ecommerce companies, including RentTheRunway, Alex and Ani, JustFab and Jet as well as the world's most innovative publishers, including Business Insider, The Economist and Hearst Magazines.
results.name: Customer Success Meetup

results.description:
We are excited to be supporting the German American Chamber of Commerce in New York (GACCNY) and STEP NYC again for a program this September. STEP NYC, GACCNY’s Startup Entrepreneurship Program, is a one-week strategy development and fundraising program supporting promising German technology startups and their expansion to the US. 


On September 30th, join us for our pitch night featuring these kick-ass German tech founders and a panel of NYC’s top venture capitalists. You can find more details and tickets here: http://ow.ly/Sja4E
results.name: Join us for Hackers & Hefeweizens!

results.name: Lululemon Run Club

results.description:
Join us for a OuiShare event: drinks and an interactive group discussion about overcoming challenges related to trust in digital and sharing economy marketplaces, led by Professor Arun Sundararajan and featuring trust experts from the Collaborative Fund, Handy, Meetup, NYU, TimeRepublik, Traity and other NYC-area platforms.

Program Agenda: 

6:30 Interactive problem-solving and design activity led by Ruhi Shamim: "What is trust? What generates trust? Who do you trust?"

6:45 Introduction by Traity​ 

7:00 Group discussion with featured panelists:
- Gabriele Donati (CEO and cofounder, TimeRepublik)
- Umang Dua (COO and cofounder, Handy)
- Seth Freeman (bestselling author and Professor, NYU)
- David Hantman (fmr Global Head of Public Policy, Airbnb)
- Jenn Louie (Head of Trust & Safety, Meetup) 
- Kanyi Maqubela (Partner, Collaborative Fund) 
moderated by Arun Sundararajan


7:40 Happy hour and networking!

The event is sponsored by Traity and co-organized by OuiShare​

About Traity: By encouraging trust in the Sharing Economy, Traity helps people make sure that the strangers, with whom you are transacting with, are decent people. Traity’s Partnership managers, Dalma Berkovics and David Sucar, will walk you through how they have built a reputation profile aggregating reviews and ratings from various online transactions.
results.how_to_find_us: KMC 11-185, Abbe-Bogen Faculty Lounge. After you enter 44 West 4th Street, walk past security, down a short corridor, and turn left to find the elevators to the higher floors. Go up to floor 11.
results.name: Trust in Marketplaces w/ Collaborative Fund, Handy, TimeRepublik, Traity,++

results.description:
A healthy mind and body is key to a successful, joyful and happy life. Learning to manage the mind, emotions, stress in today's world is a much needed life skill. Did you know our very own breath actually holds a secret to a healthy and happy existence? :) Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes! In this one hour workshop we will explore the connection between the breath, mind and body and learn a few breathing techniques to relax and rejuvenate. We will top it off with a guided meditation - no experience necessary :)

The workshop is also an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program that has benefited over 40 million people worldwide . Don't hesitate to ask for the upcoming program.

So come join us!
results.name: Happiness Inside Out

results.description:
We have been studying client side web technologies such as HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript. We will build on that knowledge by starting to learn server side web application development using the ASP.NET framework and the MVC pattern.

We will use ASP.NET MVC video courses and exercises created by Pluralsight and supplement them with member discussions. The group is very informal and selects the pace based on the members attending.

If you are interested in getting a head start, please visit http://www.asp.net/mvc
results.name: ASP.NET MVC WebApps

results.description:
Hello My Beautiful Sacred Bombshell Sister,

It is so exciting seeing your gorgeous face here. I am already basking in your energy. 

This is a sacred sister circle focused on empowerment, healing, and manifesting our desires! 


Join me. We'll share, support, raise the vibration and manifest our miracles, magic and mojo.

Let’s create magic and mayhem together. Let’s SHIFT the tectonic plates and unblock your energy and blessings for yummy love, health, abundance, and other greatness.  

This is a small self-love healing circle and lifeclass. Our focus is manifesting what you want by releasing fear and reveling in abundance.

We will also be kicking off the celebration of Breast Health Awareness Month. In attendance will be amazing healing guru and Breathwork Coach Kathleen Booker of Bravo’s “Blood, Sweat, and Heels.” She works with cancer thrivers on body love, body acceptance and alignment with our own power. I’ve worked with her, so has my family, and some friends. She ROCKS!

If you register before this Friday at midnight, the donation is only $20. If you register after that, it is $35.


Ready to cast fear aside and live out loud?

I know I am. I have been called to step my game up -- and I am doing just THAT.

Join me next week in NYC.


Register here…


You may also enjoy my last recorded conversation with one of my manifesting mentors, Ms. Jackie Collins (BELOW) which was all about how to be a powerful woman, one who creates her own life.

(link: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IWVGVEQr3QI)

Love and magic,

Abiola

P.S.  I also have a YouTube video on dealing with grief if you too have been experiencing personal transitions.

Blissings -- yes, many, many blissings!

xoxo,

Abiola
results.name: Join Me for a Powerful Evening of Healing, Support, and Co-Creating!

Join us for Scrabble every Wednesday.  People typically arrive between 6:30 and 7:00 for food, and we play from 7:00 until about 9:30 or 10:00.

We tend to play two-person games.  It's a friendly, low-key game with a range of skill levels.  Whatever people agree on in terms of dictionaries, challenges, and anything else is fine.  The main objective is to have fun.

Panera in Wayne is on Route 23 southbound, in the Brentwood Plaza (second driveway south of Ratzer Road).

results.description:
Hi Ladies,

Hope you are enjoying the end of summer.  Earlier in the summer, we had selected our book Go Set a Watchman by Harper Lee.  It has gotten a lot of buzz as the surprising sequel to her book To Kill a Mockingbird so should make for an interesting discussion. We have been meeting during the third week of the month typically but due to Jewish holidays and back-to-school nights, I have set the date for Wednesday, 9/30, same time, same place!  

Newcomers are welcome as the there are a few regulars but definitely room for new faces.  And for anyone who has not attended,  food and beverages can be ordered at our venue.

Looking forward to it!

Kathy

Bob McElrath will lead a 1-hour, informal discussion on the following topic. Afterwards we will head to Cock and Bull (23 W. 45th St. for drinks and further discussion).  Feel free to join us directly there about 8:30.

http://blog.sldx.com/announcing-whitepaper-wednesdays/ 


http://enigma.media.mit.edu/

http://enigma.media.mit.edu/enigma_full.pdf

A peer-to-peer network, enabling different parties to jointly store and run computations on data while keeping the data completely private. Enigma’s computational model is based on a highly optimized version of secure multi-party computation, guaranteed by a verifiable secret-sharing scheme. For storage, we use a modified distributed hashtable for holding secret-shared data. An external blockchain is utilized as the controller of the network, manages access control, identities and serves as a tamper-proof log of events. Security deposits and fees incentivize operation, correctness and fairness of the system. Similar to Bitcoin, Enigma removes the need for a trusted third party, enabling autonomous control of personal data. For the first time, users are able to share their data with cryptographic guarantees regarding their privacy.

We've got a brand new series called "Made for Mondays" that will be about our calling to be salt and light during the rest of the week, not just on Sundays.  That could mean in the workplace or wherever you may find yourself during the week.

This is a four-week series, divided into two parts. We will have a message on Sundays from 10:30am - 11:30am and supplement that with a weekly Wednesday night life class from 7pm - 9pm. 

You're welcome anytime.  Feel free to jump in on the series if you can't make the first week.  There's no obligation to be there on both Sunday and Wednesday.  You can attend either or, although we recommend joining both the Sunday message and Wednesday discussion to get the most out of the entire series :)

Let's be honest…does anybody really like Mondays?  Check out this funny promo video about the upcoming series:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FCcxw15GFbQ&feature=youtu.be

"Made For Monday" schedule:

- Sun, Sept 6th (Message #1)

- Wed, Sept 9th (Discussion #1)

- Sun, Sept 13th (Message #2)

- Wed, Sept 16th (Discussion #2)

- Sun, Sept 20th (Message #3)

- Wed, Sept 23rd (Discussion #3)

- Sun, Sept 27th (Message #4)

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

Michele Knaub will be presenting her case study, "Get Your Org on Board with (un)Conferencing". Michele's talk will provide the seeds for a Lean Coffee, which will transition into immediately thereafter.


Presenter: Michele Knaub, Director of Operations and Project Management for K-5 ELA, Amplify

Description: Agile practitioners are well acquainted with the (un)Conference or Open Space format (a themed but agenda-less gathering where participants determine what's important to discuss and lead the discussions themselves.) However, in organizations without shared strong Agile or Lean practices (and particularly in matrixed organizations), the format can be a tough sell. In this presentation, I will share how I got my organization excited about (un)conferences, and walk listeners through the positive impacts it had across the firm.

Location: Spotify is on 45 W. 18th Street. That's between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. They're up on the 7th floor.

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, September 30th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The October session of Cuban Salsa begins on Wednesday, 9/30!

Wednesdays (September 30th - October 21st):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 1
This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner safety in an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 classes: ONLY $60 - That's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.


*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video links of our group doing Rueda de Casino:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class on Wednesdays at 8:30pm, immediately following the beginner class.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (September 30th - October 21st):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (starting September 29th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:


Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom
*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

This month NYC Apps is excited to feature NYC's own FiftyThree and their latest app innovation. We can't wait for our members to learn more about what FiftyThree has been working on!

Tumblr is our event sponsor for September:

Overview:

7:00 pm – Good eats and conversations

7:15 pm – Discussion on the latest in the mobile landscape

7:30 pm – Presentation: FiftyThree

8:30 pm – NYC Apps after-party

Presenter:

Andrew S Allen, Cofounder / Head of Design & Marketing, FiftyThree

Amit Pitaru, Head of Prototyping, FiftyThree

Put it on Paper.

Paper, a productivity app with 15M downloads, comes to iPhone and brings with it a faster, better way to capture ideas using text, sketches, and photos.​

Ideas. They strike at any moment and come in many forms. Screenshots or photos of things we want to remember, checklists, loose sketches, stream­of­consciousness words, diagrams, emails to ourselves—whatever your idea and whenever it hits, Paper's cutting­edge tools will capture and communicate it with speed and polish.

Paper is a beautiful way to organize your thoughts, with ideas captured and stored like a wall of sticky notes that are easily arranged and connected to each other. Whether you’re remodeling your home, taking lecture notes, writing a travel list, or creating a presentation, Paper is the springboard for your ideas.

Twitter accounts to follow:

@FiftyThree / @Tumblr

NYC Apps social accounts:

@nycapps / #nycapps

Facebook page: NYC Apps

We look forward to seeing you there.

- NYC Apps
results.how_to_find_us: The event is located on the ground floor.
results.name: FiftyThree's Paper on iPhone

results.description:
Tickets (early bird prices available until 9/23): http://nycswfood2015pitchkaraoke.eventbrite.com/?aff=meetup

Join us for a night of hearing insights from Anthony Rudolf, the founder of Journee, a members' community for food, beverage, and hospitality professionals in the heart of the Flatiron District. He'll be speaking about his road to founding his own company, what keeps him up at night, and what keeps him going in trying to create a business. We'll follow the speaking portion with a fun event we like to call "Pitch Karaoke."


Pitch Karaoke seeks to help people overcome public speaking fears, educate the community on the critical elements of a 5-minute pitch, and bring together the NYC startup community in a humorous, yet relevant environment. The caveat? You won't see the slides in advance and the startups you'll be pitching are imaginary, they don't exist in real life... yet! Learn how to pitch as you improvise to randomly selected slides in a fun community event!


This workshop is also a low-key introduction to the upcoming Startup Weekend Food Edition, returning to New York in October. We want to educate newcomers to the startup/entrepreneurial space on the art of pitching and give insights from someone who lives and breathes the space.


Our gracious host, Journee, is launching a yearlong wine series in New York City and currently has a campaign to bring it all online. To learn more, visit their Kickstarter page: http://kck.st/1QpChC9.
results.name: Pitch Karaoke with Startup Weekend Food Edition at Journee ($5 early tickets)

To CJK Experts and Native Speakers:

We practice like this (including, but not limited to):

We set two tables to practice Chinese and Korean separately (Japanese is back temporarily). The session is basically for intermediate & above Chinese and Korean learners.

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, September 30th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The October session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (September 30th - October 21st):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (September 30th - October 21st):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (September 29th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description: “Lydia is dead. But they don’t know this yet.” So begins this exquisite novel about a Chinese American family living in 1970s small-town Ohio. Lydia is the favorite child of Marilyn and James Lee, and her parents are determined that she will fulfill the dreams they were unable to pursue. But when Lydia’s body is found in the local lake, the delicate balancing act that has been keeping the Lee family together is destroyed, tumbling them into chaos. A profoundly moving story of family, secrets, and longing, Everything I Never Told You is both a gripping page-turner and a sensitive family portrait, uncovering the ways in which mothers and daughters, fathers and sons, and husbands and wives struggle, all their lives, to understand one another.
results.name: Bayonne Book Club Meetup - Everything I Never Told You by Celeste Ng

results.description:
We'll meet in front of MP Taverna for a loop run along Buckout St to Mercy College, through Dobbs Ferry and back. Aftward, anyone interested can get together for a drink or refreshment at the Taverna.

Details about the run

Route: As the sun is setting earlier now, we’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the parking lot in front of MP Taverna. We'll head south on Buckout St and Half Moon Lane and then we'll use the little wooded short cut to the Ardsley Train Station. We'll run past the station, veer right onto the lit walking path into the Mercy College campus, and through the campus, exiting on to Broadway at Landing Dr. We'll head south on Broadway and then we'll weave through Ardsley Park, taking Langdon to Belmont to Field Terrace to Osceola, before exiting right onto Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A tentative route map is available <a>here</a>. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: MP Taverna parking lot (One Bridge St, Irvington, NY)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Dobbs Ferry Loop

results.description:
=== Special guest ===

The good people at OpenCityApps build 2nd City Zoning to provide a simple way for stakeholders to view zoning regulations in their area or citywide.  As always, they kept the code open source so that others could benefit, and possibly redeploy the app in different cities.

Recently, Chris forked the project for NYC to create gothamzoning.org.  At this hacknight, he'll explain the process of forking and modifying the app, what tools and technologies were used, and how he was able to stand up a fully-featured zoning app in just a few days of part-time coding.


====

What is a civic hacknight?

This is a weekly project night is for technologists, designers, developers, data scientists, map makers, and activists who are working on "civic technology" projects. Consider this to be a study hall or office hours to improve you and the city.

This night is for those who want to: 

 * work on projects
 * start a new project, or find one to join
 * get feedback from experts 
 * learn about tools for local empowerment, open data, and open government

Bring your laptop, power supply, ideas, projects, maps, data, and questions. Collectively, we will try to answer them.

-=-=-

Hacknight resources:

For first timers trying to get the most out of the night, you should bring your laptop, power supply, and watch the following videos -- Civic Hacking 101 & Civic Hacking 102.

 * Check out conversations on talk.beta.nyc
 * Join a real time conversation via slack.beta.nyc
 * Data tools: Data.Beta.NYC, data resources, maps, & tools 
 * Community projects in process - projects.beta.nyc

-=-=-

Projects & presentations:

We keep the “formal” part of the evening down to a minimum: announcements, meet your neighbor, etc. After, we will have a number of people present, specific projects, and have some skills share / education. 

Community Projects:


 * What are YOU working on?
 * Hop over to talk and tell us.

-=-=-

Event Partners:

The Code for America Brigade program is an international network of people committed to using their voices and hands, in collaboration with local governments, to make their cities better.

Microsoft Civic aims to collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the hyper-local creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology.

Accela provides civic engagement solutions for government. Accela’s solutions uniquely address the diverse needs of their constituents by making publicly available information more accessible. The Accela Civic Platform includes solutions for land management, asset management, licensing and case management, legislative management, right of way management, citizen relationship management, recreation and resource management, environmental health and safety.

-=-=-

Note about the venue:

You should RSVP with the name that appears on a photo ID. In order to give building security an RSVP list, RSVPs will close at 4:00 PM the day of the event. If you miss this deadline, most of the time security is nice and will let you in.

BetaNYC is committed to hosting safe and open events for all. By attending this event you are committing yourself to BetaNYC's Code of Conduct and Anti-Harassment Policy.
results.how_to_find_us: Use the front staircase; we'll be in the "coworking" space.
results.name: Civic Hacknight at Civic Hall with "Gotham Zoning" (Chris Whong)

group.name: #BetaNYC, NYC's open data, open gov, & civic tech community

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
This is not your typical networking event.
Climbers, Founders, and Drinks

Startup Rock Climbing hosts events in Brooklyn's best climbing gym. We get sweaty, we make friends, and we learn from incredible entrepreneurs. 

You don't have to be a good climber to come. In fact, this can be your first time doing anything athletic in a long time. We'll help you get started and you'll meet some cool people in the process.

This month we're climbing with Scot Tatelman, founder of STATE Bags.


Schedule:

7:00pm - 8:30pm - Indoor rock climbing. All levels of climbing experience welcome!
8:45pm - 9:30pm - Scot talks about the 1-to-1 business model.
9:30pm - 11:00pm - Beers!

The Talk: Scot Tatelman

STATE bags sells backpacks, but their mission goes way deeper. Like Warby Parker and Tom's Shoes, for every bag they sell, they give one away. Scot will talk about the pros & cons of running a one-for-one business, and share how they have partnered with Beyonce and Angelina Jolie to help them gain national awareness.

Make sure to buy your tickets on our Eventbrite page!

results.description:
• 

The Bible Scholar Series is an exciting one-semester Bible study class that is taught on Wall Street in Manhattan every Wednesday until November 18th. 

Amazing Christian and Jewish believers like you will gather to receive in-depth biblical and theological training. Those who complete this course will be equipped to actively fulfill the personal life calling that God has placed on their lives. This will truly be a life-changing course! Interfaith and irreligious learners are also warmly invited to enroll in this program, and they will find the curriculum enjoyable and informative. 

COMMITMENT LEVEL:


• Every Wednesday until November 18th 

• This program will consist of a two-hour class that meets each Wednesday, with a total of 11 classes during the semester (for a total of 22 hours of class time). COST & RSVP

• This is a FREE CLASS. All are welcome to join at anytime.

AT A GLANCE: 

• BIBLE KNOWLEDGE. To obtain a thorough understanding of the whole timeline of the Bible - from beginning to end. This will greatly increase you ability to see and explain God's great plan for world history. 

• CULTURAL CONTEXT. To better understand the Jewishness and cultural context in which the Old and New Testaments were written. This will help you to see many important points that God was making that often elude those who do not understand the culture that the prophets, apostles, and other biblical figures lived in.

• FAITH-OUT-OF-THE-BOX. To develop your ability to clearly communicate the saving message of Jesus to others. You will even get equipped with several high-impact Bible verses that aid greatly in sharing the message. 

• ANSWERS. To search for answers to many of the theological and philosophical questions you may have. This will strengthen your faith and confidence in talking about your faith, and it will help you to answer questions for your friends, family members, co-workers, etc. 

• TRAINING TO TEACH. For those who may feel called teach the Bible in some capacity, whether in a formal or informal setting, this class will be a very helpful path of preparation. 

• MENTORING/DISCIPLESHIP. Believers who develop in spiritual maturity should eventually be able to mentor new believers. This is an important part of spiritual growth. This course will prepare you to effectively train new believers in the Judeo-Christian faith. 

• TRAINING IN LEADERSHIP. To ready yourself to lead or co-lead successful small group Bible studies. 

• PREPPING FOR INTERNATIONAL TRIPS. To prepare yourself for high-impact world outreach and aid trips, for sharing the faith in unreached areas, and training spiritual leaders in third world nations 

• AN ALTERNATIVE TO SEMINARY. To gain some of the important knowledge that you would gain in an accredited seminary degree in Theological and Biblical Studies - but without having to commit to a massive program.

Class taught by Beau Lee, the Director of the Brooklyn Ark. More information and course descriptions, please visit BrooklynArk.com.
results.name: BIBLE SCHOLAR SERIES: A HIGH-GROWTH BIBLE STUDY CLASS

venue.name: The Made in NY Media Center by IFP

results.description:
In conjunction with our exclusive exhibition of The Doghouse, a unique, first-person reality film experience, the Made in NY Media Center is excited to present a Q&A with creators Mads Damsbo and Johan Knattrup Jensen, moderated by StoryCode’s Mike Knowlton.

After debuting last weekend at the New York Film Festival’s Convergence 2015, The Doghouse is designed to challenge and shatter all expectations of what a short film can be and the experience one can provide.

From conception to production to exhibition, we will dive deep into The Doghouse to examine the physical and mental hurdles that have faced the project since day one, including the conception of the of the idea, production and distribution challenges, and finally, getting the installation into NYFF's Convergence.

“This is really new territory. For the body, the mind, and the art.” – Politiken About The Participants

Mads Damsbo – With a background in film and media directing and with a passion for technology and experience design, Mads has found himself involved in a wide variety of alternative projects exploring the frontier of new media storytelling. He considers himself a craftsman and creative producer, and sometimes an artist and conceptual junkie.

Johann Knattrup Jensen – Johan is schooled through the progressive alternative film school Super16 where he learned the value of a good story and how it impacts an audience. With his experience in theatre, performance and as a dramatic writer, he infiltrates the core of story development at Makropol.

About The Moderator

Mike Knowlton – A digital veteran of 20 years, Mike has always pushed the boundaries of storytelling and technology. As a Creative Technologist, he founded and led numerous technology companies as well as large multi-disciplinary teams in developing complex software applications for brands including Bath & Body Works, Epoch Films, Gucci, MoMA, New York Magazine, Philosophy, Theory, Tiffany & Co., and Victoria's Secret. At his most recent venture, Murmur, he produces social films and consults with leading brands, studios, and networks on using social films to extend existing properties. Mike's background spans design, programming, advertising, and filmmaking. He graduated with a Bachelor of Arts from Miami University.
results.name: Industry Talks: VR Filmmaking with Creators of Doghouse

results.description:
Based on some of the interests in our last meet and greet, seems like a great meetup. Tickets are $15 and you must RSVP through this link: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/panel-beyond-the-screen-media-that-inspires-action-tickets-18428107967?aff=es2

Led by Net Impact's NYC Chapter, the Join Net Impact and a panel of TV and film professionals as they discuss how a new generation of creators is pushing the boundaries of a typically passive medium, building movements around films to inspire action on pressing social issues. The conversation will explore their approaches to issues and audiences, their tactics to build movements beyond the screen, and their impact to date. In short, they'll explore the power of stories to change lives.

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

The next meeting of the NJ FileMaker User Group will be held on Wednesday, September 30, from 7 PM to 9 PM at the Ridgewood Board of Education. The Center's address:

49 Cottage Place
Second Floor
Ridgewood, NJ 07451

http://tinyurl.com/ayu55jy

MEETING AGENDA: soSIMPLE Calendar with Ken d'Oronzio of Paradise Partners

soSIMPLE Calendar allows you to seamlessly add an elegant drag and drop calendar interface not only to your FileMaker Pro®-based solution, but to your web site, your iCal software, and FileMaker Go. This introduction will take you soup to nuts - integrating a calendar into your own solution from scratch, customizing it, and rolling it out for multiple use cases. Don't come too late - the initial integration happens pretty quickly.

Paradise Partners revolutionized FileMaker calendars in 2011 by introducing a user-friendly, drag & drop FileMaker calendar in a web viewer with the release of soSIMPLE v1. soSIMPLE v2 opened up the idea even further by introducing interactive calendars to FileMaker WebDirect, smartphone and direct-to-web. The latest soSIMPLE v3 added standalone calendars for FileMaker Pro and FileMaker Go, making FileMaker Server optional. The newest version also added an out-of-the-box experience with a fully featured calendar solution without any integration required.

We look forward to seeing you on the 30th. Please feel free to pass this email along to anyone you think would be interested in attending our meetings.

Best,

Debi Rubel

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.

results.description:
Have you ever heard of Dollar Shave Club? How about Casper? Does JOOR strike a bell?

If you have, then the savvy PR strategists behind all of these companies have done their job. And James Dennin, one of their own, is coming to show YOU the tricks!

Learn the ins-and-outs of Tech PR strategy for your startup without having to hire a firm for $10k per month. You'll learn how to craft a proper PR strategy, how to reach out to writers, who to establish relationships with, and how to get featured in the most important publications. In other words, get your startup noticed.

This workshop's going to be super rich with information, engaging, and interactive. Come prepared to ask questions, get involved, and getcher' learn on!

Good ol' fashioned cheese pizza, and drinks from the Harlem Brewing Co. are included in the ticket price.

Let's do this!

----
More on James Dennin:

James Dennin is a writer, content manager, and PR specialist who has worked with startups in virtually every industry from finance to fashion to mattress retail. For two years, he worked in content marketing at Kapitall, a next-generation stock trading platform launched by former E-Trade executives.

For the last year, he has worked as the Content and Media Specialist at Moxie Communications Group, where his writing has appeared on behalf of executives at Dollar Shave Club, JOOR, Casper, and many others. He has written speeches that were delivered at The Wharton School and has co-authored opinion pieces for billionaires and Congressmen. 

This summer he also worked on a number of national media campaigns, including the launch of Vroom, a used-car startup that has raised more than $100M to move the car-shopping experience online. Under his own name, James's writing has appeared in The Village Voice, Vice, BlackBook, The Street, Nasdaq, and AmericaBlog.
results.name: Workshop: Learn the ins-and-outs of Tech PR from Moxie Communications Group.

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
How To Succeed at Work & Home?  This relevant topic is affecting more and more dads who strive to be both equally successful as a dad and in the workplace. It's the topic we're going to tackle during our next evening workshop so hope you'll join us!

Our gracious host, Explore+Discover Early Learning Center, will provide some munchies, refreshments, and PIZZA as the dads get educated, learn some tips and best practices, get their questions answered, and listen to a lively discussion about juggling your family and career.  We'll be joined by two accomplished authors -  Scott Behson and Jim Joseph. who are also local New York dads.

We understand that dads enjoy the opportunity to attend workshops to assist them on a quest to become better parents.  After a successful sleep discussion with the "NYC Sleep Doctor" and informative 'Toddlerhood ' talk with Tovah Klein, we're excited about "Survival as a Working Dad" with Scott and Jim...the next in our series of FREE educational workshops offered to NYC Dads Group members in 2015.


Jim Joseph and Scott Behson are both good friends of NYC Dads Group and have been roving the country on their respective book tours, so it's with great pleasure that we get to chat with them together.

* This 75-90 minute discussion including Q&A is completely FREE for NYC Dads Group members

* All attendees will have the opportunity to purchase "The Working Dad's Survivial Guide" by Scott Behson and "Out and About Dad" by Jim Josph as well as get them signed after the discussion

* Light snacks, refreshments, and PIZZA will be served


* Space can accommodate 30 parents

Scott Behson, PhD, is a professor of management at Fairleigh Dickinson University, a national expert in work and family issues, a featured speaker at the recent White House Summit on Working Families, and, most importantly, a busy involved dad.

He's the author of The Working Dad’s Survival Guide: How to Succeed at Work and at Home, the first book of its kind to provide advice and encouragement for working fathers, helping them to achieve success in their careers while also being the involved, loving dads they always wanted to be. Scott founded and runs the popular blog, "Fathers, Work, and Family," dedicated to helping working fathers and encouraging more supportive workplaces. He writes regularly for the Harvard Business Review Online, Huffington Post and the Good Men Project, and has also been published in TIME and The Wall Street Journal. He frequently appears in media, including MSNBC, NPR and Fox News.   

Jim Joseph: Entrepreneur of the Year, Agency of the Year, Consumer Launch Campaign of the Year, Most Creative Agency, Best Place to Work, Social Media Icon, Hall of Fame – these are the accolades that Jim Joseph has amassed through his long career in marketing. But none are more important than the daily badge he wears with the most pride – Dad.

As the Chief Integrated Marketing Officer and President of the Americas for Cohn & Wolfe, Jim brings over twenty-five years of consumer marketing leadership, bold management prowess, and a fine head of hair to the agency. Jim’s an award-winning three-time author; a professor at New York University; and a member of the Board of Directors for the number one branding school in the country, The Brandcenter at VCU. 

His latest adventure is his most personal to date..a brand new book, Out and About Dad, chronicles his unique journey as a father during a very unique time in our cultural evolution.

Explore+Discover is dedicated to offering quality education and care for infants and toddlers in a social setting where creativity is nurtured. Our professionally trained staff, responsive curriculum and beautiful facility offer an experience of natural discovery where each child thrives and grows socially, physically and cognitively every single day. Website:  http://www.explorediscover.net/

**Disclosure Note: This is a sponsored event with Explore+Discover in which we have received compensation. We limit our sponsored collaborations to relevant partners that offer products and services we believe in. **

results.description:
Wednesday night Baladi Beat Belly Dance with Tarik Sultan, new time, new room!

You don't need a choreography! Dare to be different! Even a dead fish can go with the flow! LET'S DANCE!

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, we don't make cookie cutter dancers, we make individuals! Dare to be stand out from the crowd! Dare to be one of a kind! Dare to be YOU!

Classes meet every Wednesday 7:30pm to 8:30pm in room 3A

$25 a single class, $50 for 3 classes, $65 for 4.

Cash or check made out to "Tarik Sultan". Check out the website at www.tariksultan.net/Class_Schedule.html

For more information call[masked] or email at [masked]

results.description:
We will begin our evening introducing the pendulum and its various uses from healing, kinesiology, to your most trusted tool.

Using the pendulum we will also demonstrate how Reiki opens, cleanses and clears the chakras.

Following the demonstration, everyone will have an opportunity to receive Reiki. 

The Light Within Us Reiki Healing Circle is where practitioners, and those with an interest in Reiki, can participate in giving, as well as receiving Reiki.

Reiki can help reduce physical pain, balance your energy system, increase mental clarity, enhance creativity, and facilitate personal healing and spiritual growth.

All levels and styles of Reiki are welcome.
results.name: Pendulum Chakra Balancing and Reiki Share

results.description:
Are you a woman who is seeking to live a  more conscious, aware life with more inner-peace, contentment, self-love and inner-freedom?

Have you been going through challenging transitions and growth that can feel overwhelming

Do you sometimes feel alone on this journey, and would like to connect with other like-minded women on the path, so you know you're not the only one experiencing these feelings?

At these gatherings we will hold a space that is welcoming, healing, supportive and with a sense of the sacred that feels nourishing and nurturing - where we can step out of our everyday lives and tune in to explore our deeper longings, desires, yearnings and callings, and how we can live more fulfilling and meaningful lives.  We will share, listen, grow, heal, laugh, cry and evolve together.  Bring the wise-woman within you and give her a place to open up and blossom.


THE INTENTION & OBJECTIVE OF THIS GROUP IS TO:


• Hold a sacred space for self-reflection, growth, evolution and healing, allowing us to see with new awareness and perspective and helping us to live our lives more consciously and intentionally.

• Share our challenges, triumphs and aspirations with like-minded women; reawaken to our dreams, deeper purpose and authenticity, get some clarity around what's in our way, what might be holding us back and what we might need to move us forward; and inspire and be inspired by each other to our next steps.

• Create a nurturing atmosphere of support as we explore deeper possibilities of the lessons life is seeking to teach us, in order to heal, evolve and build a strong inner foundation.

• Inspire self-love, self-care and self-respect, and a deeper and stronger  relationship with ourselves.  To realize that it is our own acceptance, recognition and love we are truly seeking ....so we learn to stop abandoning and betraying our own selves.  To really get that with our connection to Source, we truly have everything inside that we need.

• Learn how to identify and meet our own deepest needs ....so we feel cared for, nurtured, nourished and completely loved and adored.  And to learn how to, more and more, connect with and build a relationship with the inner-companion ....the sacred beloved that accompanies us in this existence, that is always within us ....and always available to us.

• Develop compassion and appreciation of self, and to learn how to speak lovingly, kindly and supportively to ourselves, instead of the negative ways we can many times speak with, and treat ourselves.

• Refresh and renew our spirit, re-connect us to our deeper nature, our inherent wholeness and the gift of our powerful & sacred feminine energy.

***FOR THIS MEETUP:  Please write down the 2 or 3 biggest challenges/ obstacles that you're dealing with right now, or the 2 or 3 biggest questions about achieving your next level of growth - - or just write what you'd like to get out of coming to the group. PLEASE BRING THIS WITH YOU. 


For more information about my work with women, and working with me privately, you can to to www.renamajeed.com .
results.name: Women's Wisdom Circle Gathering, WEDNESDAY Sept. 30

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)
results.name: Wed Night Crokinole!

results.description:
Come rehearsal with us at our regular location, the Music Conservatory of Westchester! No need to prepare, just show up with your instrument and get ready to play. We have around 30-40 people at most rehearsals (most members are not on the Meetup page) so don't worry, you will have a full orchestra to play with.

RSVP on Meetup to let us know you're coming, or email [masked].

Parking: The Conservatory asks that orchestra musicians *not* park in the Conservatory parking lot unless you are a tuition paying student of either the Conservatory of the Steffi Nossen School of Dance. Street parking is free after 6pm, and there is a large municipal lot across Central Ave from City Limits (24hr meters in the lot).

The first rehearsal is free. Subsequent rehearsals are $10/rehearsal or a discounted annual rate.
results.how_to_find_us: Northern end of Central Ave, just south of City Limits Diner and across rt. 119 from the County Center
results.name: Rehearse with the New Westchester Symphony Orchestra

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description: Meditation helps us find happiness within. Meditation can be done while you are walking, shopping, working, even while watching T.V.! results.description:
REGISTER HERE, FOR FREE.


This is a free introductory livestream that will be followed in subsequent weeks by a 5-part paid series called “Being the Infinite Self.” Participants may attend via computer, tablet, or smartphone, or may dial-in via phone.

Award-winning author, channel & psychic Paul Selig, will lead a live, interactive video webinar where he will explain his work, deliver a channeled lecture and allow participants to ask questions directly to his Guides. Paul’s Guides have been delivering new, groundbreaking teachings on Mastery. Paul’s 4th channeled text, The Book of Mastery will be released in January 2016 from Tarcher/Penguin, so this is a unique opportunity to experience this new work in advance of the book’s release. Paul and his Guides will lead you on a journey of self-development, at once building awareness of your own life purpose and building your ability to improve life for others.

A video recording of each session will be made available to all registered attendees at no additional charge so that if you miss the session or simply want to review it again, you can do so at your leisure.

Register here for the free livestream. For questions about the session, please email [masked] or call[masked]

The 5-part paid series will take place on Wednesday evenings at 8 pm Eastern Time: October 7, 14, 21, 28 and November 4. Participation in a prior session or series is not a prerequisite.

For those who haven’t registered for previous sessions, you are welcome to download those videos from Paul’s website at the AV page.

ABOUT PAUL SELIG

Paul Selig had a spiritual experience in 1987 that left him clairvoyant. He studied a form of energy healing, working at Marianne Williamson’s Manhattan Center for Living and in private practice. Paul began to “hear” for his clients, and much of his work now is as a clairaudient, clairvoyant, channel, and empath. He has led channeled energy groups for many years and, in 2009, he was invited to channel at the Esalen Institute’s Superpowers symposium, where he was filmed for the documentary Authors of the Impossible. He was also featured on the documentary series The uneXplained on the A&E/BIO channel. His books include I Am the Word, The Book of Love and Creation, and The Book of Knowing and Worth. His fourth book, The Book of Mastery, will be published in January 2016 by Tarcher/Penguin.

Register here for the free livestream.
results.name: FREE Channeled Livestream with Paul Selig: "Being the Infinite Self"

group.name: Channeled Workshops with Medium Paul Selig

results.description:
This is a really unique and special experience, the kitchen table at Empellon Cocina. From the restaurant:

We built a special table at Empellón Cocina where the kitchen can interact directly with its guests. For this table we prepare a collection of our newest creations in the format of a multi course tasting menu nightly.


Empellon Cocina is run by former WD-50 pastry chef Alex Stupak. These will be our four seats! Please note the tasting menu is special and reviews for the restaurant are not for this tasting menu, which has been featured in many different publications.


There have been a few articles written about this tasting menu:

http://ny.eater.com/2015/5/20/8631243/alex-stupak-is-back-in-the-kitchen-with-a-long-tasting-menu-at

http://nycfoodie.com/blog/2015/7/15/nyc-foodie-quick-bite-the-kitchen-table-at-empellon-cocina

http://thefooddocu.blogspot.com/2015/07/the-kitchen-table-at-empellon-cocina.html

We will be doing the longer (22+ course) menu which starts at 8 PM. The cost is $165 plus tax and tip. Given that the restaurant asks for a credit card I am asking for the $165 up front. Per usual, I will return this in full when you show up for the meal (it's just to cover me in case someone doesn't show up, which I can't imagine would happen). The deposit is not refundable but you are welcome to give your spot to someone else if you become unable to make it. The dinner lasts approximately 2.5 hours.


Thanks and hope to see you there!
results.name: Empellon Cocina- Kitchen Table
